197 //
198 // This small template class resembles a try-finally block
199 //
200 // It sets var to val_entry in the constructor and
201 // var to val_exit in the destructor.
202 //
203 template <typename T>
204 class VarSetter
205 {
206 public:
207  VarSetter(T* var, T val_entry, T val_exit)
208  {
209  mVar = var;
210  mValExit = val_exit;
211  *var = val_entry;
212  }
213 
214  ~VarSetter()
215  {
216  *mVar = mValExit;
217  }
218 private:
219  T* mVar;
220  T mValExit;
221 };

316 #if defined(__WXMAC__)
317  bool GetData()
318  {
319  bool foundSupported = false;
320 #if !wxCHECK_VERSION(3, 0, 0)
321  bool firstFileAdded = false;
322  OSErr result;
323 
324  UInt16 items = 0;
325  CountDragItems((DragReference)m_currentDrag, &items);
326 
327  for (UInt16 index = 1; index <= items; index++) {
328 
329  DragItemRef theItem = 0;
330  GetDragItemReferenceNumber((DragReference)m_currentDrag, index, &theItem);
331 
332  UInt16 flavors = 0;
333  CountDragItemFlavors((DragReference)m_currentDrag, theItem , &flavors ) ;
334 
335  for (UInt16 flavor = 1 ;flavor <= flavors; flavor++) {
336 
337  FlavorType theType = 0;
338  result = GetFlavorType((DragReference)m_currentDrag, theItem, flavor, &theType);
339  if (theType != kDragPromisedFlavorFindFile && theType != kDragFlavorTypeHFS) {
340  continue;
341  }
342  foundSupported = true;
343 
344  Size dataSize = 0;
345  GetFlavorDataSize((DragReference)m_currentDrag, theItem, theType, &dataSize);
346 
347  Ptr theData = new char[dataSize];
348  GetFlavorData((DragReference)m_currentDrag, theItem, theType, (void*) theData, &dataSize, 0L);
349 
350  wxString name;
351  if (theType == kDragPromisedFlavorFindFile) {
352  name = wxMacFSSpec2MacFilename((FSSpec *)theData);
353  }
354  else if (theType == kDragFlavorTypeHFS) {
355  name = wxMacFSSpec2MacFilename(&((HFSFlavor *)theData)->fileSpec);
356  }
357 
358  delete[] theData;
359 
360  if (!firstFileAdded) {
361  // reset file list
362  ((wxFileDataObject*)GetDataObject())->SetData(0, "");
363  firstFileAdded = true;
364  }
365 
366  ((wxFileDataObject*)GetDataObject())->AddFile(name);
367 
368  // We only want to process one flavor
369  break;
370  }
371  }
372 #endif
373  return foundSupported;
374  }

410  bool OnDropFiles(wxCoord WXUNUSED(x), wxCoord WXUNUSED(y), const wxArrayString& filenames)
411  {
412  //sort by OD non OD. load Non OD first so user can start editing asap.
413  wxArrayString sortednames(filenames);
414 
415  ODManager::Pause();
416 
417  sortednames.Sort(CompareNoCaseFileName);
418  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < sortednames.GetCount(); i++) {
419 
420  mProject->Import(sortednames[i]);
421  }
422  mProject->HandleResize(); // Adjust scrollers for NEW track sizes.
423 
424  ODManager::Resume();
425 
426  return true;
427  }

436 bool ImportXMLTagHandler::HandleXMLTag(const wxChar *tag, const wxChar **attrs)
437 {
438  if (wxStrcmp(tag, wxT("import")) || attrs==NULL || (*attrs)==NULL || wxStrcmp(*attrs++, wxT("filename")))
439  return false;
440  wxString strAttr = *attrs;
441  if (!XMLValueChecker::IsGoodPathName(strAttr))
442  {
443  // Maybe strAttr is just a fileName, not the full path. Try the project data directory.
444  wxFileName fileName(mProject->GetDirManager()->GetProjectDataDir(), strAttr);
445  if (XMLValueChecker::IsGoodFileName(strAttr, fileName.GetPath(wxPATH_GET_VOLUME)))
446  strAttr = fileName.GetFullPath();
447  else
448  {
449  wxLogWarning(wxT("Could not import file: %s"), strAttr.c_str());
450  return false;
451  }
452  }
453 
454  WaveTrackArray trackArray;
455  mProject->Import(strAttr, &trackArray);
456  if (trackArray.empty())
457  return false;
458 
459  // Handle other attributes, now that we have the tracks.
460  attrs++;
461  const wxChar** pAttr;
462  bool bSuccess = true;
463 
464  for (size_t i = 0; i < trackArray.size(); i++)
465  {
466  // Most of the "import" tag attributes are the same as for "wavetrack" tags,
467  // so apply them via WaveTrack::HandleXMLTag().
468  bSuccess = trackArray[i]->HandleXMLTag(wxT("wavetrack"), attrs);
469 
470  // "offset" tag is ignored in WaveTrack::HandleXMLTag except for legacy projects,
471  // so handle it here.
472  double dblValue;
473  pAttr = attrs;
474  while (*pAttr)
475  {
476  const wxChar *attr = *pAttr++;
477  const wxChar *value = *pAttr++;
478  const wxString strValue = value;
479  if (!wxStrcmp(attr, wxT("offset")) &&
480  XMLValueChecker::IsGoodString(strValue) &&
481  Internat::CompatibleToDouble(strValue, &dblValue))
482  trackArray[i]->SetOffset(dblValue);
483  }
484  }
485  return bSuccess;
486 };

488 AudacityProject *CreateNewAudacityProject()
489 {
490  bool bMaximized;
491  wxRect wndRect;
492  bool bIconized;
493  GetNextWindowPlacement(&wndRect, &bMaximized, &bIconized);
494 
495  //Create and show a NEW project
496  AudacityProject *p = new AudacityProject(NULL, -1,
497  wxDefaultPosition,
498  wxSize(wndRect.width, wndRect.height));
499  gAudacityProjects.Add(p);
500 
501  // wxGTK3 seems to need to require creating the window using default position
502  // and then manually positioning it.
503  p->SetPosition(wndRect.GetPosition());
504 
505  if(bMaximized) {
506  p->Maximize(true);
507  }
508  else if (bIconized) {
509  // if the user close down and iconized state we could start back up and iconized state
510  // p->Iconize(TRUE);
511  }
512 
513  //Initialise the Listener
514  gAudioIO->SetListener(p);
515 
516  //Set the NEW project as active:
517  SetActiveProject(p);
518 
519  // Okay, GetActiveProject() is ready. Now we can get its CommandManager,
520  // and add the shortcut keys to the tooltips.
521  p->GetControlToolBar()->RegenerateToolsTooltips();
522 
523  ModuleManager::Get().Dispatch(ProjectInitialized);
524 
525  p->Show(true);
526 
527  return p;
528 }

555 // BG: The default size and position of the first window
556 void GetDefaultWindowRect(wxRect *defRect)
557 {
558  *defRect = wxGetClientDisplayRect();
559 
560  int width = 940;
561  int height = 674;
562 
563  //These conditional values assist in improving placement and size
564  //of NEW windows on different platforms.
565 #ifdef __WXGTK__
566  height += 20;
567 #endif
568 
569 #ifdef __WXMSW__
570  height += 40;
571 #endif
572 
573 #ifdef __WXMAC__
574  height += 55;
575 #endif
576 
577  // Use screen size where it is smaller than the values we would like.
578  // Otherwise use the values we would like, and centred.
579  if (width < defRect->width)
580  {
581  defRect->x = (defRect->width - width)/2;
582  defRect->width = width;
583  }
584 
585  if (height < defRect->height)
586  {
587  defRect->y = (defRect->height - height)/2;
588  // Bug 1119 workaround
589  // Small adjustment for very small Mac screens.
590  // If there is only a tiny space at the top
591  // then instead of vertical centre, align to bottom.
592  const int pixelsFormenu = 60;
593  if( defRect->y < pixelsFormenu )
594  defRect->y *=2;
595  defRect->height = height;
596  }
597 }
598 
599 bool IsWindowAccessible(wxRect *requestedRect)
600 {
601  wxDisplay display;
602  wxRect targetTitleRect(requestedRect->GetLeftTop(), requestedRect->GetBottomRight());
603  targetTitleRect.x += 15;
604  targetTitleRect.width -= 100;
605  if (targetTitleRect.width < 165) targetTitleRect.width = 165;
606  targetTitleRect.height = 15;
607  int targetBottom = targetTitleRect.GetBottom();
608  int targetRight = targetTitleRect.GetRight();
609  for (int i = targetTitleRect.GetLeft(); i < targetRight; i++) {
610  for (int j = targetTitleRect.GetTop(); j < targetBottom; j++) {
611  int monitor = display.GetFromPoint(wxPoint(i, j));
612  if (monitor != wxNOT_FOUND) {
613  return TRUE;
614  }
615  }
616  }
617  return FALSE;
618 }
619 
620 // BG: Calculate where to place the next window (could be the first window)
621 // BG: Does not store X and Y in prefs. This is intentional.
622 //
623 // LL: This should NOT need to be this complicated...FIXME
624 void GetNextWindowPlacement(wxRect *nextRect, bool *pMaximized, bool *pIconized)
625 {
626  int inc = 25;
627 
628  wxRect defaultRect;
629  GetDefaultWindowRect(&defaultRect);
630 
631  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/Window/Maximized"), pMaximized, false);
632  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/Window/Iconized"), pIconized, false);
633 
634  wxRect windowRect;
635  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/Window/X"), &windowRect.x, defaultRect.x);
636  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/Window/Y"), &windowRect.y, defaultRect.y);
637  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/Window/Width"), &windowRect.width, defaultRect.width);
638  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/Window/Height"), &windowRect.height, defaultRect.height);
639 
640  wxRect normalRect;
641  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/Window/Normal_X"), &normalRect.x, defaultRect.x);
642  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/Window/Normal_Y"), &normalRect.y, defaultRect.y);
643  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/Window/Normal_Width"), &normalRect.width, defaultRect.width);
644  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/Window/Normal_Height"), &normalRect.height, defaultRect.height);
645 
646  // Workaround 2.1.1 and earlier bug on OSX...affects only normalRect, but let's just
647  // validate for all rects and plats
648  if (normalRect.width == 0 || normalRect.height == 0) {
649  normalRect = defaultRect;
650  }
651  if (windowRect.width == 0 || windowRect.height == 0) {
652  windowRect = defaultRect;
653  }
654 
655  wxRect screenRect = wxGetClientDisplayRect();
656 
657 #if defined(__WXMAC__)
658  // On OSX, the top of the window should never be less than the menu height,
659  // so something is amiss if it is
660  if (normalRect.y < screenRect.y) {
661  normalRect = defaultRect;
662  }
663  if (windowRect.y < screenRect.y) {
664  windowRect = defaultRect;
665  }
666 #endif
667 
668 
669  // Make sure initial sizes fit within the display bounds
670  // We used to trim the sizes which could result in ridiculously small windows.
671  // contributing to bug 1243.
672  // Now instead if the window doesn't fit the screen, we use the default
673  // window instead, which we know does.
674  if (!screenRect.Contains( normalRect )) {
675  normalRect = defaultRect;
676  }
677  if (!screenRect.Contains( windowRect )) {
678  windowRect = defaultRect;
679  }
680 
681  if (gAudacityProjects.IsEmpty()) {
682  if (*pMaximized || *pIconized) {
683  *nextRect = normalRect;
684  }
685  else {
686  *nextRect = windowRect;
687  }
688  if (!IsWindowAccessible(nextRect)) {
689  *nextRect = defaultRect;
690  }
691  }
692  else {
693  bool validWindowSize = false;
694  AudacityProject * validProject = NULL;
695  size_t numProjects = gAudacityProjects.Count();
696  for (int i = numProjects; i > 0 ; i--) {
697  if (!gAudacityProjects[i-1]->IsIconized()) {
698  validWindowSize = true;
699  validProject = gAudacityProjects[i-1];
700  break;
701  }
702  }
703  if (validWindowSize) {
704  *nextRect = validProject->GetRect();
705  *pMaximized = validProject->IsMaximized();
706  *pIconized = validProject->IsIconized();
707  }
708  else {
709  *nextRect = normalRect;
710  }
711 
712  //Placement depends on the increments
713  nextRect->x += inc;
714  nextRect->y += inc;
715  }
716 
717 
718  //Have we hit the right side of the screen?
719  wxPoint bottomRight = nextRect->GetBottomRight();
720  if (bottomRight.x > screenRect.GetRight()) {
721  int newWidth = screenRect.GetWidth() - nextRect->GetLeft();
722  if (newWidth < defaultRect.GetWidth()) {
723  nextRect->x = windowRect.x;
724  nextRect->y = windowRect.y;
725  nextRect->width = windowRect.width;
726  }
727  else {
728  nextRect->width = newWidth;
729  }
730  }
731 
732  //Have we hit the bottom of the screen?
733  bottomRight = nextRect->GetBottomRight();
734  if (bottomRight.y > screenRect.GetBottom()) {
735  nextRect->y -= inc;
736  bottomRight = nextRect->GetBottomRight();
737  if (bottomRight.y > screenRect.GetBottom()) {
738  nextRect->SetBottom(screenRect.GetBottom());
739  }
740  }
741 
742  if (!IsWindowAccessible(nextRect)) {
743  *nextRect = defaultRect;
744  }
745 }

747 static wxString CreateUniqueName()
748 {
749  static int count = 0;
750  return wxDateTime::Now().Format(wxT("%Y-%m-%d %H-%M-%S")) +
751  wxString::Format(wxT(" N-%i"), ++count);
752 }

759  HSBarID,
760  VSBarID,
761  TrackPanelID
762 };

769  EVT_SIZE(AudacityProject::OnSize)
770  EVT_SHOW(AudacityProject::OnShow)

772  EVT_ACTIVATE(AudacityProject::OnActivate)
773  EVT_COMMAND_SCROLL_LINEUP(HSBarID, AudacityProject::OnScrollLeftButton)
774  EVT_COMMAND_SCROLL_LINEDOWN(HSBarID, AudacityProject::OnScrollRightButton)
775  EVT_COMMAND_SCROLL(HSBarID, AudacityProject::OnScroll)

788 AudacityProject::AudacityProject(wxWindow * parent, wxWindowID id,
789  const wxPoint & pos,
790  const wxSize & size)
791  : wxFrame(parent, id, wxT("Audacity"), pos, size),
792  mRate((double) gPrefs->Read(wxT("/SamplingRate/DefaultProjectSampleRate"), AudioIO::GetOptimalSupportedSampleRate())),
793  mDefaultFormat((sampleFormat) gPrefs->
794  Read(wxT("/SamplingRate/DefaultProjectSampleFormat"), floatSample)),
795  mSnapTo(gPrefs->Read(wxT("/SnapTo"), SNAP_OFF)),
796  mSelectionFormat(gPrefs->Read(wxT("/SelectionFormat"), wxT(""))),
797  mFrequencySelectionFormatName(gPrefs->Read(wxT("/FrequencySelectionFormatName"), wxT(""))),
798  mBandwidthSelectionFormatName(gPrefs->Read(wxT("/BandwidthSelectionFormatName"), wxT(""))),
799  mUndoManager(safenew UndoManager),
800  mViewInfo(0.0, 1.0, ZoomInfo::GetDefaultZoom())
801 {
802  // Note that the first field of the status bar is a dummy, and it's width is set
803  // to zero latter in the code. This field is needed for wxWidgets 2.8.12 because
804  // if you move to the menu bar, the first field of the menu bar is cleared, which
805  // is undesirable behaviour.
806  // In addition, the help strings of menu items are by default sent to the first
807  // field. Currently there are no such help strings, but it they were introduced, then
808  // there would need to be an event handler to send them to the appropriate field.
809  mStatusBar = CreateStatusBar(4);
810 
811  wxGetApp().SetMissingAliasedFileWarningShouldShow(true);
812 
813  // MM: DirManager is created dynamically, freed on demand via ref-counting
814  // MM: We don't need to Ref() here because it start with refcount=1
815  mDirManager = new DirManager();
816 
817  // Create track list
818  mTracks = new TrackList();
819  mLastSavedTracks = NULL;
820 
821  // Register for tracklist updates
822  mTracks->Connect(EVT_TRACKLIST_UPDATED,
823  wxCommandEventHandler(AudacityProject::OnTrackListUpdated),
824  NULL,
825  this);
826 
827  //
828  // Initialize view info (shared with TrackPanel)
829  //
830 
831  UpdatePrefs();
832 
833  mLockPlayRegion = false;
834 
835  // Make sure valgrind sees mIsSyncLocked is initialized, even
836  // though we're about to set it from prefs.
837  mIsSyncLocked = false;
838  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/SyncLockTracks"), &mIsSyncLocked, false);
839 
840  CreateMenusAndCommands();
841 
842  // LLL: Read this!!!
843  //
844  // Until the time (and cpu) required to refresh the track panel is
845  // reduced, leave the following window creations in the order specified.
846  // This will place the refresh of the track panel last, allowing all
847  // the others to get done quickly.
848  //
849  // Near as I can tell, this is only a problem under Windows.
850  //
851 
852  //
853  // Create the ToolDock
854  //
855  mToolManager = new ToolManager( this );
856  GetSelectionBar()->SetListener(this);
857 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
858  GetSpectralSelectionBar()->SetListener(this);
859 #endif
860  mToolManager->LayoutToolBars();
861 
862  //
863  // Create the horizontal ruler
864  //
865  mRuler = safenew AdornedRulerPanel( this,
866  wxID_ANY,
867  wxDefaultPosition,
868  wxSize( -1, AdornedRulerPanel::GetRulerHeight() ),
869  &mViewInfo );
870 
871  //
872  // Create the TrackPanel and the scrollbars
873  //
874  wxWindow * pPage;
875 
876 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_NOTEBOOK
877  // We are using a notebook (tabbed panel), so we create the notebook and add pages.
878  GuiFactory Factory;
879  wxNotebook * pNotebook;
880  mMainPanel = Factory.AddPanel(
881  this, wxPoint( left, top ), wxSize( width, height ) );
882  pNotebook = Factory.AddNotebook( mMainPanel );
883  /* i18n-hint: This is an experimental feature where the main panel in
884  Audacity is put on a notebook tab, and this is the name on that tab.
885  Other tabs in that notebook may have instruments, patch panels etc.*/
886  pPage = Factory.AddPage( pNotebook, _("Main Mix"));
887 #else
888  // Not using a notebook, so we place the track panel inside another panel,
889  // this keeps the notebook code and normal code consistant and also
890  // paves the way for adding additional windows inside the track panel.
891  mMainPanel = safenew wxPanel(this, -1,
892  wxDefaultPosition,
893  wxDefaultSize,
894  wxNO_BORDER);
895  mMainPanel->SetSizer( safenew wxBoxSizer(wxVERTICAL) );
896  pPage = mMainPanel;
897  // Set the colour here to the track panel background to avoid
898  // flicker when Audacity starts up.
899  // However, that leads to areas next to the horizontal scroller
900  // being painted in background colour and not scroller background
901  // colour, so suppress this for now.
902  //pPage->SetBackgroundColour( theTheme.Colour( clrDark ));
903 #endif
904 
905  wxBoxSizer *bs;
906  {
907  auto ubs = std::make_unique<wxBoxSizer>(wxVERTICAL);
908  bs = ubs.get();
909  bs->Add(mToolManager->GetTopDock(), 0, wxEXPAND | wxALIGN_TOP);
910  bs->Add(mRuler, 0, wxEXPAND);
911  bs->Add(pPage, 1, wxEXPAND);
912  bs->Add(mToolManager->GetBotDock(), 0, wxEXPAND);
913  SetAutoLayout(true);
914  SetSizer(ubs.release());
915  }
916  bs->Layout();
917 
918  // The right hand side translates to NEW TrackPanel(... in normal
919  // Audacity without additional DLLs.
920  mTrackPanel = TrackPanel::FactoryFunction(pPage,
921  TrackPanelID,
922  wxDefaultPosition,
923  wxDefaultSize,
924  mTracks,
925  &mViewInfo,
926  this,
927  mRuler);
928 
929  // LLL: When Audacity starts or becomes active after returning from
930  // another application, the first window that can accept focus
931  // will be given the focus even if we try to SetFocus(). By
932  // creating the scrollbars after the TrackPanel, we resolve
933  // several focus problems.
934  mHsbar = safenew ScrollBar(pPage, HSBarID, wxSB_HORIZONTAL);
935  mVsbar = safenew ScrollBar(pPage, VSBarID, wxSB_VERTICAL);
936 
937  // LLL: When Audacity starts or becomes active after returning from
938  // another application, the first window that can accept focus
939  // will be given the focus even if we try to SetFocus(). By
940  // making the TrackPanel that first window, we resolve several
941  // keyboard focus problems.
942  pPage->MoveBeforeInTabOrder(mToolManager->GetTopDock());
943 
944  bs = (wxBoxSizer *)pPage->GetSizer();
945 
946  {
947  // Top horizontal grouping
948  auto hs = std::make_unique<wxBoxSizer>(wxHORIZONTAL);
949 
950  // Track panel
951  hs->Add(mTrackPanel, 1, wxEXPAND | wxALIGN_LEFT | wxALIGN_TOP);
952 
953  {
954  // Vertical grouping
955  auto vs = std::make_unique<wxBoxSizer>(wxVERTICAL);
956 
957  // Vertical scroll bar
958  vs->Add(mVsbar, 1, wxEXPAND | wxALIGN_TOP);
959  hs->Add(vs.release(), 0, wxEXPAND | wxALIGN_TOP);
960  }
961 
962  bs->Add(hs.release(), 1, wxEXPAND | wxALIGN_LEFT | wxALIGN_TOP);
963  }
964 
965  {
966  // Bottom horizontal grouping
967  auto hs = std::make_unique<wxBoxSizer>(wxHORIZONTAL);
968 
969  // Bottom scrollbar
970  hs->Add(mTrackPanel->GetLeftOffset() - 1, 0);
971  hs->Add(mHsbar, 1, wxALIGN_BOTTOM);
972  hs->Add(mVsbar->GetSize().GetWidth(), 0);
973  bs->Add(hs.release(), 0, wxEXPAND | wxALIGN_LEFT);
974  }
975 
976  // Lay it out
977  pPage->SetAutoLayout(true);
978  pPage->Layout();
979 
980 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_NOTEBOOK
981  AddPages(this, Factory, pNotebook);
982 #endif
983 
984  mMainPanel->Layout();
985 
986  wxASSERT( mTrackPanel->GetProject()==this);
987 
988  // MM: Give track panel the focus to ensure keyboard commands work
989  mTrackPanel->SetFocus();
990 
991  // Create tags object
992  mTags = std::make_shared<Tags>();
993 
994  InitialState();
995  FixScrollbars();
996  mRuler->SetLeftOffset(mTrackPanel->GetLeftOffset()); // bevel on AdornedRuler
997  mRuler->SetProject(this);
998 
999  //
1000  // Set the Icon
1001  //
1002 
1003  // loads either the XPM or the windows resource, depending on the platform
1004 #if !defined(__WXMAC__) && !defined(__WXX11__)
1005  {
1006 #if defined(__WXMSW__)
1007  wxIcon ic{ wxICON(AudacityLogo) };
1008 #elif defined(__WXGTK__)
1009  wxIcon ic{wxICON(AudacityLogoAlpha)};
1010 #else
1011  wxIcon ic{};
1012  ic.CopyFromBitmap(theTheme.Bitmap(bmpAudacityLogo48x48));
1013 #endif
1014  SetIcon(ic);
1015  }
1016 #endif
1017  mIconized = false;
1018 
1019  mTrackFactory = new TrackFactory(mDirManager, &mViewInfo);
1020 
1021  int widths[] = {0, GetControlToolBar()->WidthForStatusBar(mStatusBar), -1, 150};
1022  mStatusBar->SetStatusWidths(4, widths);
1023  wxString msg = wxString::Format(_("Welcome to Audacity version %s"),
1024  AUDACITY_VERSION_STRING);
1025  mStatusBar->SetStatusText(msg, mainStatusBarField);
1026  mStatusBar->SetStatusText(GetControlToolBar()->StateForStatusBar(), stateStatusBarField);
1027  mLastStatusUpdateTime = ::wxGetUTCTime();
1028 
1029  mTimer = new wxTimer(this, AudacityProjectTimerID);
1030  mTimer->Start(200);
1031 
1032 #if wxUSE_DRAG_AND_DROP
1033  // We can import now, so become a drag target
1034 // SetDropTarget(new AudacityDropTarget(this));
1035 // mTrackPanel->SetDropTarget(new AudacityDropTarget(this));
1036  mTrackPanel->SetDropTarget(new DropTarget(this));
1037 #endif
1038 
1039  wxTheApp->Connect(EVT_AUDIOIO_CAPTURE,
1040  wxCommandEventHandler(AudacityProject::OnCapture),
1041  NULL,
1042  this);
1043 
1044  //Initialize the last selection adjustment time.
1045  mLastSelectionAdjustment = ::wxGetLocalTimeMillis();
1046 
1047 }

1054  }
1055

1057  wxCommandEventHandler(AudacityProject::OnCapture),
1058  NULL,

1070 void AudacityProject::UpdatePrefsVariables()
1071 {
1072  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/AudioFiles/ShowId3Dialog"), &mShowId3Dialog, true);
1073  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/AudioFiles/NormalizeOnLoad"),&mNormalizeOnLoad, false);
1074  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/AutoScroll"), &mViewInfo.bUpdateTrackIndicator, true);
1075  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/EmptyCanBeDirty"), &mEmptyCanBeDirty, true );
1076  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/Help"), &mHelpPref, wxT("InBrowser") );
1077  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/SelectAllOnNone"), &mSelectAllOnNone, true);
1078  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/ShowSplashScreen"), &mShowSplashScreen, true);
1079  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/Solo"), &mSoloPref, wxT("Simple"));
1080  // Update the old default to the NEW default.
1081  if (mSoloPref == wxT("Standard"))
1082  mSoloPref = wxT("Simple");
1083  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/TracksFitVerticallyZoomed"), &mTracksFitVerticallyZoomed, false);
1084  // gPrefs->Read(wxT("/GUI/UpdateSpectrogram"), &mViewInfo.bUpdateSpectrogram, true);
1085 
1086  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/SamplingRate/DefaultProjectSampleRate"), &mRate, AudioIO::GetOptimalSupportedSampleRate());
1087  mDefaultFormat = (sampleFormat) gPrefs->Read(wxT("/SamplingRate/DefaultProjectSampleFormat"), floatSample);
1088 
1089  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/AudioIO/SeekShortPeriod"), &mSeekShort, 1.0);
1090  gPrefs->Read(wxT("/AudioIO/SeekLongPeriod"), &mSeekLong, 15.0);
1091 }

1093 void AudacityProject::UpdatePrefs()
1094 {
1095  UpdatePrefsVariables();
1096 
1097  SetProjectTitle();
1098 
1099  if (mTrackPanel) {
1100  mTrackPanel->UpdatePrefs();
1101  }
1102  if (mMixerBoard)
1103  mMixerBoard->UpdatePrefs();
1104 
1105  if (mToolManager) {
1106  mToolManager->UpdatePrefs();
1107  }
1108 
1109  if (mRuler) {
1110  mRuler->UpdatePrefs();
1111  }
1112 
1113  // The toolbars will be recreated, so make sure we don't leave
1114  // a stale pointer hanging around.
1115  mLastFocusedWindow = NULL;
1116 }

1128 void AudacityProject::RedrawProject(const bool bForceWaveTracks /*= false*/)
1129 {
1130  FixScrollbars();
1131  if (bForceWaveTracks && mTracks)
1132  {
1133  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
1134  Track* pTrack = iter.First();
1135  while (pTrack)
1136  {
1137  if (pTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
1138  {
1139  WaveTrack* pWaveTrack = (WaveTrack*)pTrack;
1140  WaveClipList::compatibility_iterator node = pWaveTrack->GetClipIterator();
1141  while (node)
1142  {
1143  WaveClip *clip = node->GetData();
1144  clip->MarkChanged();
1145  node = node->GetNext();
1146  }
1147  }
1148  pTrack = iter.Next();
1149  }
1150  }
1151  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
1152 }

1220 wxString AudacityProject::GetName()
1221 {
1222  wxString name = wxFileNameFromPath(mFileName);
1223 
1224  // Chop off the extension
1225  size_t len = name.Len();
1226  if (len > 4 && name.Mid(len - 4) == wxT(".aup"))
1227  name = name.Mid(0, len - 4);
1228 
1229  return name;

1256 bool AudacityProject::SnapSelection()
1257 {
1258  if (mSnapTo != SNAP_OFF) {
1259  SelectedRegion &selectedRegion = mViewInfo.selectedRegion;
1260  NumericConverter nc(NumericConverter::TIME, GetSelectionFormat(), 0, GetRate());
1261  const bool nearest = (mSnapTo == SNAP_NEAREST);
1262 
1263  const double oldt0 = selectedRegion.t0();
1264  const double oldt1 = selectedRegion.t1();
1265 
1266  nc.ValueToControls(oldt0, nearest);
1267  nc.ControlsToValue();
1268  const double t0 = nc.GetValue();
1269 
1270  nc.ValueToControls(oldt1, nearest);
1271  nc.ControlsToValue();
1272  const double t1 = nc.GetValue();
1273 
1274  if (t0 != oldt0 || t1 != oldt1) {
1275  selectedRegion.setTimes(t0, t1);
1276  TP_DisplaySelection();
1277  return true;
1278  }
1279  }
1280 
1281  return false;
1282 }

1329 double AudacityProject::SSBL_GetRate() const
1330 {
1331  // Return maximum of project rate and all track rates.
1332  double rate = mRate;
1333 
1334  TrackListOfKindIterator iterWaveTrack(Track::Wave, mTracks);
1335  WaveTrack *pWaveTrack = static_cast<WaveTrack*>(iterWaveTrack.First());
1336  while (pWaveTrack)
1337  {
1338  rate = std::max(rate, pWaveTrack->GetRate());
1339  pWaveTrack = static_cast<WaveTrack*>(iterWaveTrack.Next());
1340  }
1341 
1342  return rate;
1343 }

1371 void AudacityProject::SSBL_ModifySpectralSelection(double &bottom, double &top, bool done)
1372 {
1373 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
1374  double nyq = SSBL_GetRate() / 2.0;
1375  if (bottom >= 0.0)
1376  bottom = std::min(nyq, bottom);
1377  if (top >= 0.0)
1378  top = std::min(nyq, top);
1379  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setFrequencies(bottom, top);
1380  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
1381  if (done) {
1382  ModifyState(false);
1383  }
1384 #else
1385  bottom; top; done;
1386 #endif
1387 }

1460 void AudacityProject::OnScrollLeft()
1461 {
1462  wxInt64 pos = mHsbar->GetThumbPosition();
1463  // move at least one scroll increment
1464  pos -= wxMax((wxInt64)(sbarHjump * mViewInfo.sbarScale), 1);
1465  pos = wxMax(pos, 0);
1466 
1467  if (pos != mHsbar->GetThumbPosition()) {
1468  mHsbar->SetThumbPosition((int)pos);
1469  FinishAutoScroll();
1470  }
1471 }
1476 
1477 void AudacityProject::OnScrollRight()
1478 {
1479  wxInt64 pos = mHsbar->GetThumbPosition();
1480  // move at least one scroll increment
1481  // use wxInt64 for calculation to prevent temporary overflow
1482  pos += wxMax((wxInt64)(sbarHjump * mViewInfo.sbarScale), 1);
1483  wxInt64 max = mHsbar->GetRange() - mHsbar->GetThumbSize();
1484  pos = wxMin(pos, max);
1485 
1486  if (pos != mHsbar->GetThumbPosition()) {
1487  mHsbar->SetThumbPosition((int)pos);
1488  FinishAutoScroll();
1489  }
1490 }

1526 
1527 double AudacityProject::ScrollingLowerBoundTime() const
1528 {
1529  if (!mViewInfo.bScrollBeyondZero)
1530  return 0;
1531  const double screen = mTrackPanel->GetScreenEndTime() - mViewInfo.h;
1532  return std::min(mTracks->GetStartTime(), -screen / 2.0);
1533 }
1534 
1535 // PRL: Bug1197: we seem to need to compute all in double, to avoid differing results on Mac
1536 // That's why ViewInfo::TimeRangeToPixelWidth was defined, with some regret.
1537 double AudacityProject::PixelWidthBeforeTime(double scrollto) const
1538 {
1539  const double lowerBound = ScrollingLowerBoundTime();
1540  return
1541  // Ignoring fisheye is correct here
1542  mViewInfo.TimeRangeToPixelWidth(scrollto - lowerBound);
1543 }
1544 
1545 void AudacityProject::SetHorizontalThumb(double scrollto)
1546 {
1547  const int max = mHsbar->GetRange() - mHsbar->GetThumbSize();
1548  const int pos =
1549  std::min(max,
1550  std::max(0,
1551  int(floor(0.5 + PixelWidthBeforeTime(scrollto) * mViewInfo.sbarScale))));
1552  mHsbar->SetThumbPosition(pos);
1553 }

1555 //
1556 // This method, like the other methods prefaced with TP, handles TrackPanel
1557 // 'callback'.
1558 //
1559 void AudacityProject::TP_ScrollWindow(double scrollto)
1560 {
1561  SetHorizontalThumb(scrollto);
1562 
1563  // Call our Scroll method which updates our ViewInfo variables
1564  // to reflect the positions of the scrollbars
1565  wxScrollEvent dummy;
1566  OnScroll(dummy);
1567 }
1568 
1569 //
1570 // Scroll vertically. This is called for example by the mouse wheel
1571 // handler in Track Panel. A positive argument makes the window
1572 // scroll down, while a negative argument scrolls up.
1573 //
1574 void AudacityProject::TP_ScrollUpDown(int delta)
1575 {
1576  int oldPos = mVsbar->GetThumbPosition();
1577  int pos = oldPos + delta;
1578  int max = mVsbar->GetRange() - mVsbar->GetThumbSize();
1579 
1580  // Can be negative in case of only one track
1581  if (max < 0)
1582  max = 0;
1583 
1584  if (pos > max)
1585  pos = max;
1586  else if (pos < 0)
1587  pos = 0;
1588 
1589  if (pos != oldPos)
1590  {
1591  mVsbar->SetThumbPosition(pos);
1592 
1593  wxScrollEvent dummy;
1594  OnScroll(dummy);
1595  }
1596 }
1597 
1598 void AudacityProject::FixScrollbars()
1599 {
1600  if(!mTracks)
1601  return;
1602 
1603  bool refresh = false;
1604  bool rescroll = false;
1605 
1606  int totalHeight = (mTracks->GetHeight() + 32);
1607 
1608  int panelWidth, panelHeight;
1609  mTrackPanel->GetTracksUsableArea(&panelWidth, &panelHeight);
1610 
1611  // (From Debian...at least I think this is the change cooresponding
1612  // to this comment)
1613  //
1614  // (2.) GTK critical warning "IA__gtk_range_set_range: assertion
1615  // 'min < max' failed" because of negative numbers as result of window
1616  // size checking. Added a sanity check that straightens up the numbers
1617  // in edge cases.
1618  if (panelWidth < 0) {
1619  panelWidth = 0;
1620  }
1621  if (panelHeight < 0) {
1622  panelHeight = 0;
1623  }
1624 
1625  double LastTime =
1626  std::max(mTracks->GetEndTime(), mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
1627 
1628  const double screen = GetScreenEndTime() - mViewInfo.h;
1629  const double halfScreen = screen / 2.0;
1630 
1631  // If we can scroll beyond zero,
1632  // Add 1/2 of a screen of blank space to the end
1633  // and another 1/2 screen before the beginning
1634  // so that any point within the union of the selection and the track duration
1635  // may be scrolled to the midline.
1636  // May add even more to the end, so that you can always scroll the starting time to zero.
1637  const double lowerBound = ScrollingLowerBoundTime();
1638  const double additional = mViewInfo.bScrollBeyondZero
1639  ? -lowerBound + std::max(halfScreen, screen - LastTime)
1640  : screen / 4.0;
1641 
1642  mViewInfo.total = LastTime + additional;
1643 
1644  // Don't remove time from total that's still on the screen
1645  mViewInfo.total = std::max(mViewInfo.total, mViewInfo.h + screen);
1646 
1647  if (mViewInfo.h < lowerBound) {
1648  mViewInfo.h = lowerBound;
1649  rescroll = true;
1650  }
1651 
1652  mViewInfo.sbarTotal = (wxInt64) (mViewInfo.GetTotalWidth());
1653  mViewInfo.sbarScreen = (wxInt64)(panelWidth);
1654  mViewInfo.sbarH = (wxInt64) (mViewInfo.GetBeforeScreenWidth());
1655 
1656  int lastv = mViewInfo.vpos;
1657  // PRL: Can someone else find a more elegant solution to bug 812, than
1658  // introducing this boolean member variable?
1659  // Setting mVSbar earlier, int HandlXMLTag, didn't succeed in restoring
1660  // the vertical scrollbar to its saved position. So defer that till now.
1661  // mbInitializingScrollbar should be true only at the start of the life
1662  // of an AudacityProject reopened from disk.
1663  if (!mbInitializingScrollbar) {
1664  mViewInfo.vpos = mVsbar->GetThumbPosition() * mViewInfo.scrollStep;
1665  }
1666  mbInitializingScrollbar = false;
1667 
1668  if (mViewInfo.vpos >= totalHeight)
1669  mViewInfo.vpos = totalHeight - 1;
1670  if (mViewInfo.vpos < 0)
1671  mViewInfo.vpos = 0;
1672 
1673  bool oldhstate;
1674  bool oldvstate;
1675  bool newhstate = (GetScreenEndTime() - mViewInfo.h) < mViewInfo.total;
1676  bool newvstate = panelHeight < totalHeight;
1677 
1678 #ifdef __WXGTK__
1679  oldhstate = mHsbar->IsShown();
1680  oldvstate = mVsbar->IsShown();
1681  mHsbar->Show(newhstate);
1682  mVsbar->Show(panelHeight < totalHeight);
1683 #else
1684  oldhstate = mHsbar->IsEnabled();
1685  oldvstate = mVsbar->IsEnabled();
1686  mHsbar->Enable(newhstate);
1687  mVsbar->Enable(panelHeight < totalHeight);
1688 #endif
1689 
1690  if (panelHeight >= totalHeight && mViewInfo.vpos != 0) {
1691  mViewInfo.vpos = 0;
1692 
1693  refresh = true;
1694  rescroll = false;
1695  }
1696  if (!newhstate && mViewInfo.sbarH != 0) {
1697  mViewInfo.sbarH = 0;
1698 
1699  refresh = true;
1700  rescroll = false;
1701  }
1702 
1703  if (lastv != mViewInfo.vpos) {
1704  UpdateFirstVisible();
1705  }
1706 
1707  // wxScrollbar only supports int values but we need a greater range, so
1708  // we scale the scrollbar coordinates on demand. We only do this if we
1709  // would exceed the int range, so we can always use the maximum resolution
1710  // available.
1711 
1712  // Don't use the full 2^31 max int range but a bit less, so rounding
1713  // errors in calculations do not overflow max int
1714  wxInt64 maxScrollbarRange = (wxInt64)(2147483647 * 0.999);
1715  if (mViewInfo.sbarTotal > maxScrollbarRange)
1716  mViewInfo.sbarScale = ((double)maxScrollbarRange) / mViewInfo.sbarTotal;
1717  else
1718  mViewInfo.sbarScale = 1.0; // use maximum resolution
1719 
1720  {
1721  int scaledSbarH = (int)(mViewInfo.sbarH * mViewInfo.sbarScale);
1722  int scaledSbarScreen = (int)(mViewInfo.sbarScreen * mViewInfo.sbarScale);
1723  int scaledSbarTotal = (int)(mViewInfo.sbarTotal * mViewInfo.sbarScale);
1724  const int offset =
1725  int(floor(0.5 + mViewInfo.sbarScale * PixelWidthBeforeTime(0.0)));
1726 
1727  mHsbar->SetScrollbar(scaledSbarH + offset, scaledSbarScreen, scaledSbarTotal,
1728  scaledSbarScreen, TRUE);
1729  mHsbar->Refresh();
1730  }
1731 
1732  // Vertical scrollbar
1733  mVsbar->SetScrollbar(mViewInfo.vpos / mViewInfo.scrollStep,
1734  panelHeight / mViewInfo.scrollStep,
1735  totalHeight / mViewInfo.scrollStep,
1736  panelHeight / mViewInfo.scrollStep, TRUE);
1737  mVsbar->Refresh();
1738 
1739  if (refresh || (rescroll &&
1740  (GetScreenEndTime() - mViewInfo.h) < mViewInfo.total)) {
1741  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
1742  }
1743 
1744  UpdateMenus();
1745 
1746  if (oldhstate != newhstate || oldvstate != newvstate) {
1747  UpdateLayout();
1748  }
1749 }
1750 
1751 Track *AudacityProject::GetFirstVisible()
1752 {
1753  if (!mViewInfo.track && mTracks) {
1754  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
1755  for (Track *t = iter.First(); t; t = iter.Next()) {
1756  int y = t->GetY();
1757  int h = t->GetHeight();
1758  if (y >= mViewInfo.vpos || y + h >= mViewInfo.vpos) {
1759  mViewInfo.track = t;
1760  break;
1761  }
1762  }
1763  }
1764 
1765  return mViewInfo.track;
1766 }
1767 
1768 void AudacityProject::UpdateFirstVisible()
1769 {
1770  if (!mViewInfo.track || !mTracks) {
1771  return;
1772  }
1773 
1774  Track *t = mViewInfo.track;
1775  mViewInfo.track = NULL;
1776 
1777  if (t->GetY() > mViewInfo.vpos) {
1778  while (t && t->GetY() > mViewInfo.vpos) {
1779  t = mTracks->GetPrev(t);
1780  }
1781  }
1782 
1783  while (t) {
1784  int y = t->GetY();
1785  int h = t->GetHeight();
1786  if (y >= mViewInfo.vpos || y + h >= mViewInfo.vpos) {
1787  mViewInfo.track = t;
1788  return;
1789  }
1790  t = mTracks->GetNext(t);
1791  }
1792 
1793  return;
1794 }
1795 
1796 void AudacityProject::UpdateLayout()
1797 {
1798  if (!mTrackPanel)
1799  return;
1800 
1801  mToolManager->LayoutToolBars();
1802  Layout();
1803 
1804  // Retrieve size of this projects window
1805  wxSize mainsz = GetSize();
1806 
1807  // Retrieve position of the track panel to use as the size of the top
1808  // third of the window
1809  wxPoint tppos = ClientToScreen(mTrackPanel->GetParent()->GetPosition());
1810 
1811  // Retrieve position of bottom dock to use as the size of the bottom
1812  // third of the window
1813  wxPoint sbpos = ClientToScreen(mToolManager->GetBotDock()->GetPosition());
1814 
1815  // The "+ 50" is the minimum height of the TrackPanel
1816  SetSizeHints(250, (mainsz.y - sbpos.y) + tppos.y + 50, 20000, 20000);
1817 }
1818 
1819 void AudacityProject::HandleResize()
1820 {
1821  if (!mTrackPanel)
1822  return;
1823 
1824  FixScrollbars();
1825 
1826  UpdateLayout();
1827 }

1829 void AudacityProject::OnIconize(wxIconizeEvent &event)
1830 {
1831 
1832  int VisibleProjectCount = 0;
1833 
1834  //JKC: On Iconizing we get called twice. Don't know
1835  // why but it does no harm.
1836  // Should we be returning true/false rather than
1837  // void return? I don't know.
1838  mIconized = event.IsIconized();
1839 
1840  unsigned int i;
1841 
1842  for(i=0;i<gAudacityProjects.Count();i++){
1843  if(gAudacityProjects[i]){
1844  if( !gAudacityProjects[i]->mIconized )
1845  VisibleProjectCount++;
1846  }
1847  }

1858 
1859 void AudacityProject::OnSize(wxSizeEvent & event)
1860 {
1861  // (From Debian)
1862  //
1863  // (3.) GTK critical warning "IA__gdk_window_get_origin: assertion
1864  // 'GDK_IS_WINDOW (window)' failed": Received events of type wxSizeEvent
1865  // on the main project window cause calls to "ClientToScreen" - which is
1866  // not available until the window is first shown. So the class has to
1867  // keep track of wxShowEvent events and inhibit those actions until the
1868  // window is first shown.
1869  if (mShownOnce) {
1870  HandleResize();
1871  if (!this->IsMaximized() && !this->IsIconized())
1872  SetNormalizedWindowState(this->GetRect());
1873  }
1874  event.Skip();
1875 }
1876 
1877 void AudacityProject::OnShow(wxShowEvent & event)
1878 {
1879  // Remember that the window has been shown at least once
1880  mShownOnce = true;
1881 
1882  // (From Debian...see also TrackPanel::OnTimer and AudacityTimer::Notify)
1883  //
1884  // Description: Workaround for wxWidgets bug: Reentry in clipboard
1885  // The wxWidgets bug http://trac.wxwidgets.org/ticket/16636 prevents
1886  // us from doing clipboard operations in wxShowEvent and wxTimerEvent
1887  // processing because those event could possibly be processed during
1888  // the (not sufficiently protected) Yield() of a first clipboard
1889  // operation, causing reentry. Audacity had a workaround in place
1890  // for this problem (the class "CaptureEvents"), which however isn't
1891  // applicable with wxWidgets 3.0 because it's based on changing the
1892  // gdk event handler, a change that would be overridden by wxWidgets's
1893  // own gdk event handler change.
1894  // Instead, as a NEW workaround, specifically protect those processings
1895  // of wxShowEvent and wxTimerEvent that try to do clipboard operations
1896  // from being executed within Yield(). This is done by delaying their
1897  // execution by posting pure wxWidgets events - which are never executed
1898  // during Yield().
1899  // Author: Martin Stegh fer <martin@steghoefer.eu>
1900  // Bug-Debian: https://bugs.debian.org/765341
1901 
1902  // the actual creation/showing of the window).
1903  // Post the event instead of calling OnSize(..) directly. This ensures that
1904  // this is a pure wxWidgets event (no GDK event behind it) and that it
1905  // therefore isn't processed within the YieldFor(..) of the clipboard
1906  // operations (workaround for Debian bug #765341).
1907  wxSizeEvent *sizeEvent = new wxSizeEvent(GetSize());
1908  GetEventHandler()->QueueEvent(sizeEvent);
1909 
1910  // Further processing by default handlers
1911  event.Skip();
1912 }
1913

1960 void AudacityProject::OnScroll(wxScrollEvent & WXUNUSED(event))
1961 {
1962  const wxInt64 hlast = mViewInfo.sbarH;
1963 
1964  const double lowerBound = ScrollingLowerBoundTime();
1965  const wxInt64 offset = PixelWidthBeforeTime(0.0);
1966 
1967  mViewInfo.sbarH =
1968  (wxInt64)(mHsbar->GetThumbPosition() / mViewInfo.sbarScale) - offset;
1969 
1970  if (mViewInfo.sbarH != hlast) {
1971  int width;
1972  mTrackPanel->GetTracksUsableArea(&width, NULL);
1973  mViewInfo.SetBeforeScreenWidth(mViewInfo.sbarH, width, lowerBound);
1974  }
1975 
1976 
1977  if (mViewInfo.bScrollBeyondZero) {
1978  enum { SCROLL_PIXEL_TOLERANCE = 10 };
1979  if (std::abs(mViewInfo.TimeToPosition(0.0, 0
1980  )) < SCROLL_PIXEL_TOLERANCE) {
1981  // Snap the scrollbar to 0
1982  mViewInfo.h = 0;
1983  SetHorizontalThumb(0.0);
1984  }
1985  }
1986 
1987  int lastv = mViewInfo.vpos;
1988  mViewInfo.vpos = mVsbar->GetThumbPosition() * mViewInfo.scrollStep;
1989 
1990  if (lastv != mViewInfo.vpos) {
1991  UpdateFirstVisible();
1992  }
1993 
1994  //mchinen: do not always set this project to be the active one.
1995  //a project may autoscroll while playing in the background
1996  //I think this is okay since OnMouseEvent has one of these.
1997  //SetActiveProject(this);
1998 
1999  if (!mAutoScrolling) {
2000  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
2001  }
2002 }
2003 
2007 bool AudacityProject::TryToMakeActionAllowed( wxUint32 & flags, wxUint32 flagsRqd, wxUint32 mask )
2008 {
2009  bool bAllowed;
2010 
2011  if( flags == 0 )
2012  flags = GetUpdateFlags();
2013 
2014  bAllowed = ((flags & mask) == (flagsRqd & mask));
2015  if( bAllowed )
2016  return true;
2017 
2018  // Action is not allowed
2019  // IF not set up to select all audio in that case, THEN return with failure.
2020  if( !mSelectAllOnNone )
2021  return false;
2022 
2023  wxUint32 MissingFlags = (flags & ~flagsRqd) & mask;
2024 
2025  // IF selecting all audio won't do any good, THEN return with failure.
2026  if( (flags & WaveTracksExistFlag) == 0 )
2027  return false;
2028  if( (MissingFlags & ~( TimeSelectedFlag | WaveTracksSelectedFlag))!=0)
2029  return false;
2030 
2031  OnSelectAll();
2032  flags = GetUpdateFlags();
2033  bAllowed = ((flags & mask) == (flagsRqd & mask));
2034  return bAllowed;
2035 }

2046  else

2055 void AudacityProject::OnActivate(wxActivateEvent & event)
2056 {
2057  // Activate events can fire during window teardown, so just
2058  // ignore them.
2059  if (mIsDeleting) {
2060  return;
2061  }
2062 
2063  mActive = event.GetActive();
2064 
2065 #if defined(__WXGTK__)
2066  // See bug #294 for explanation
2067  mTrackPanel->SetFocus();
2068 #endif
2069 
2070  // Under Windows, focus can be "lost" when returning to
2071  // Audacity from a different application.
2072  //
2073  // This was observed by minimizing all windows using WINDOWS+M and
2074  // then ALT+TAB to return to Audacity. Focus will be given to the
2075  // project window frame which is not at all useful.
2076  //
2077  // So, when the project window receives a deactivate event, we
2078  // remember which child had the focus. Then, when we receive the
2079  // activate event, we restore that focus to the child or the track
2080  // panel if no child had the focus (which probably should never happen).
2081  if (!mActive) {
2082  // We only want to remember the last focused window if FindFocus() returns
2083  // a window within the current project frame.
2084  wxWindow *w = FindFocus();
2085  if (wxGetTopLevelParent(w) ==this) {
2086  mLastFocusedWindow = w;
2087  }
2088  }
2089  else {
2090  SetActiveProject(this);
2091  if (mLastFocusedWindow) {
2092  mLastFocusedWindow->SetFocus();
2093  }
2094  else {
2095  if (mTrackPanel) {
2096  mTrackPanel->SetFocus();
2097  }
2098  }
2099  // No longer need to remember the last focused window
2100  mLastFocusedWindow = NULL;
2101  }
2102  event.Skip();
2103 }
2104 
2105 bool AudacityProject::IsActive()
2106 {
2107  return mActive;
2108 }
2109 
2110 void AudacityProject::OnMouseEvent(wxMouseEvent & event)
2111 {
2112  if (event.ButtonDown())
2113  SetActiveProject(this);
2114 }

2116 // LL: All objects that have a reference to the DirManager should
2117 // be deleted before the final mDirManager->Deref() in this
2118 // routine. Failing to do so can cause unwanted recursion
2119 // and/or attempts to DELETE objects twice.
2120 void AudacityProject::OnCloseWindow(wxCloseEvent & event)
2121 {
2122  // We are called for the wxEVT_CLOSE_WINDOW, wxEVT_END_SESSION, and
2123  // wxEVT_QUERY_END_SESSION, so we have to protect against multiple
2124  // entries. This is a hack until the whole application termination
2125  // process can be reviewed and reworked. (See bug #964 for ways
2126  // to exercise the bug that instigated this hack.)
2127  if (mIsBeingDeleted)
2128  {
2129  event.Skip();
2130  return;
2131  }
2132 
2133  if (event.CanVeto() && (::wxIsBusy() || mbBusyImporting))
2134  {
2135  event.Veto();
2136  return;
2137  }
2138 
2139  if (mFreqWindow) {
2140  mFreqWindow->Destroy();
2141  mFreqWindow = NULL;
2142  }
2143 
2144  if (mContrastDialog) {
2145  mContrastDialog->Destroy();
2146  mContrastDialog = NULL;
2147  }
2148 
2149  // Check to see if we were playing or recording
2150  // audio, and if so, make sure Audio I/O is completely finished.
2151  // The main point of this is to properly push the state
2152  // and flush the tracks once we've completely finished
2153  // recording NEW state.
2154  // This code is derived from similar code in
2155  // AudacityProject::~AudacityProject() and TrackPanel::OnTimer().
2156  if (GetAudioIOToken()>0 &&
2157  gAudioIO->IsStreamActive(GetAudioIOToken())) {
2158 
2159  // We were playing or recording audio, but we've stopped the stream.
2160  wxCommandEvent dummyEvent;
2161  GetControlToolBar()->OnStop(dummyEvent);
2162 
2163  FixScrollbars();
2164  SetAudioIOToken(0);
2165  RedrawProject();
2166  }
2167  else if (gAudioIO->IsMonitoring()) {
2168  gAudioIO->StopStream();
2169  }
2170 
2171  // These two lines test for an 'empty' project.
2172  // of course it could still have a history at this stage.
2173  TrackListIterator iter2(mTracks);
2174  bool bHasTracks = (iter2.First() != NULL);
2175 
2176  // We may not bother to prompt the user to save, if the
2177  // project is now empty.
2178  if (event.CanVeto() && (mEmptyCanBeDirty || bHasTracks)) {
2179  if (GetUndoManager()->UnsavedChanges()) {
2180 
2181  wxString Message = _("Save changes before closing?");
2182  if( !bHasTracks )
2183  {
2184  Message += _("\nIf saved, the project will have no tracks.\n\nTo save any previously open tracks:\nCancel, Edit > Undo until all tracks\nare open, then File > Save Project.");
2185  }
2186  int result = wxMessageBox( Message,
2187  _("Save changes?"),
2188  wxYES_NO | wxCANCEL | wxICON_QUESTION,
2189  this);
2190 
2191  if (result == wxCANCEL || (result == wxYES && !Save())) {
2192  event.Veto();
2193  return;
2194  }
2195  }
2196  }
2197 
2198  ModuleManager::Get().Dispatch(ProjectClosing);
2199 
2200  // Stop the timer since there's no need to update anything anymore
2201  delete mTimer;
2202  mTimer = NULL;
2203 
2204  // The project is now either saved or the user doesn't want to save it,
2205  // so there's no need to keep auto save info around anymore
2206  DeleteCurrentAutoSaveFile();
2207 
2208  // DMM: Save the size of the last window the user closes
2209  //
2210  // LL: Save before doing anything else to the window that might make
2211  // its size change.
2212  SaveWindowSize();
2213 
2214  mLastFocusedWindow = NULL;
2215  mIsDeleting = true;
2216 
2217  // Mac: we never quit as the result of a close.
2218  // Other systems: we quit only when the close is the result of an external
2219  // command (on Windows, those are taskbar closes, "X" box, Alt+F4, etc.)
2220  bool quitOnClose;
2221 #ifdef __WXMAC__
2222  quitOnClose = false;
2223 #else
2224  quitOnClose = !mMenuClose;
2225 #endif
2226 
2227  // DanH: If we're definitely about to quit, DELETE the clipboard.
2228  // Doing this after Deref'ing the DirManager causes problems.
2229  if ((gAudacityProjects.GetCount() == 1) && (quitOnClose || gIsQuitting))
2230  DeleteClipboard();
2231 
2232  // JKC: For Win98 and Linux do not detach the menu bar.
2233  // We want wxWidgets to clean it up for us.
2234  // TODO: Is there a Mac issue here??
2235  // SetMenuBar(NULL);
2236 
2237  // Lock all blocks in all tracks of the last saved version, so that
2238  // the blockfiles aren't deleted on disk when we DELETE the blockfiles
2239  // in memory. After it's locked, DELETE the data structure so that
2240  // there's no memory leak.
2241  if (mLastSavedTracks) {
2242  TrackListIterator iter(mLastSavedTracks);
2243  Track *t = iter.First();
2244  while (t) {
2245  if (t->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
2246  ((WaveTrack *) t)->CloseLock();
2247  t = iter.Next();
2248  }
2249 
2250  mLastSavedTracks->Clear(true);
2251  delete mLastSavedTracks;
2252  mLastSavedTracks = NULL;
2253  }
2254 
2255  // Get rid of the history window
2256  // LL: Destroy it before the TrackPanel and ToolBars since they
2257  // may/will get additional wxEVT_PAINT events since window
2258  // destruction may be queued. This seems to only be a problem
2259  // on the Mac.
2260  if (mHistoryWindow) {
2261  mHistoryWindow->Destroy();
2262  mHistoryWindow = NULL;
2263  }
2264 
2265  // Destroy the TrackPanel early so it's not around once we start
2266  // deleting things like tracks and such out from underneath it.
2267  // Check validity of mTrackPanel per bug 584 Comment 1.
2268  // Deeper fix is in the Import code, but this failsafes against crash.
2269  if (mTrackPanel)
2270  {
2271  mTrackPanel->Destroy();
2272  mTrackPanel = NULL; // Make sure this gets set...see HandleResize()
2273  }
2274 
2275  // Delete the tool manager before the children since it needs
2276  // to save the state of the toolbars.
2277  delete mToolManager;
2278  mToolManager = NULL;
2279 
2280  DestroyChildren();
2281 
2282  delete mTrackFactory;
2283  mTrackFactory = NULL;
2284 
2285  mTags.reset();
2286 
2287  delete mImportXMLTagHandler;
2288  mImportXMLTagHandler = NULL;
2289 
2290  // Unregister for tracklist updates
2291  mTracks->Disconnect(EVT_TRACKLIST_UPDATED,
2292  wxCommandEventHandler(AudacityProject::OnTrackListUpdated),
2293  NULL,
2294  this);
2295 
2296  // Delete all the tracks to free up memory and DirManager references.
2297  mTracks->Clear(true);
2298  delete mTracks;
2299  mTracks = NULL;
2300 
2301  // This must be done before the following Deref() since it holds
2302  // references to the DirManager.
2303  GetUndoManager()->ClearStates();
2304 
2305  // MM: Tell the DirManager it can now DELETE itself
2306  // if it finds it is no longer needed. If it is still
2307  // used (f.e. by the clipboard), it will recognize this
2308  // and will destroy itself later.
2309  //
2310  // LL: All objects with references to the DirManager should
2311  // have been deleted before this.
2312  mDirManager->Deref();
2313 
2314  AllProjectsDeleteLock();
2315  gAudacityProjects.Remove(this);
2316  AllProjectsDeleteUnlock();
2317 
2318  if (gActiveProject == this) {
2319  // Find a NEW active project
2320  if (gAudacityProjects.Count() > 0) {
2321  SetActiveProject(gAudacityProjects[0]);
2322  }
2323  else {
2324  SetActiveProject(NULL);
2325  }
2326  }
2327 
2328  // Since we're going to be destroyed, make sure we're not to
2329  // receive audio notifications anymore.
2330  if (gAudioIO->GetListener() == this) {
2331  gAudioIO->SetListener(gActiveProject);
2332  }
2333 
2334  if (gAudacityProjects.IsEmpty() && !gIsQuitting) {
2335 
2336 #if !defined(__WXMAC__)
2337  if (quitOnClose) {
2338  QuitAudacity();
2339  }
2340  else {
2341  wxGetApp().SetWindowRectAlreadySaved(FALSE);
2342  CreateNewAudacityProject();
2343  }
2344 #endif
2345  }
2346 
2347  Destroy();
2348 
2349  mIsBeingDeleted = true;
2350 }

2363 // static method, can be called outside of a project
2364 wxArrayString AudacityProject::ShowOpenDialog(const wxString &extraformat, const wxString &extrafilter)
2365 {
2366  FormatList l;
2367  wxString filter;
2368  wxString all;
2371 
2373  if (extraformat != wxEmptyString)
2374  { // additional format specified
2375  all = extrafilter + wxT(';');
2376  // add it to the "all supported files" filter string
2377  }
2378 
2379  // Construct the filter
2380  Importer::Get().GetSupportedImportFormats(&l);
2381 
2382  for (const auto &format : l) {
2383  /* this loop runs once per supported _format_ */
2384  const Format *f = &format;
2385 
2386  wxString newfilter = f->formatName + wxT("|");
2387  // bung format name into string plus | separator
2388  for (size_t i = 0; i < f->formatExtensions.size(); i++) {
2389  /* this loop runs once per valid _file extension_ for file containing
2390  * the current _format_ */
2391  if (!newfilter.Contains(wxT("*.") + f->formatExtensions[i] + wxT(";")))
2392  newfilter += wxT("*.") + f->formatExtensions[i] + wxT(";");
2393  if (!all.Contains(wxT("*.") + f->formatExtensions[i] + wxT(";")))
2394  all += wxT("*.") + f->formatExtensions[i] + wxT(";");
2395  }
2396  newfilter.RemoveLast(1);
2397  filter += newfilter;
2398  filter += wxT("|");
2399  }
2400  all.RemoveLast(1);
2401  filter.RemoveLast(1);
2402 
2403  // For testing long filters
2404 #if 0
2405  wxString test = wxT("*.aaa;*.bbb;*.ccc;*.ddd;*.eee");
2406  all = test + wxT(';') + test + wxT(';') + test + wxT(';') +
2407  test + wxT(';') + test + wxT(';') + test + wxT(';') +
2408  test + wxT(';') + test + wxT(';') + test + wxT(';') +
2409  all;
2410 #endif
2411 
2412  /* i18n-hint: The vertical bars and * are essential here.*/
2413  wxString mask = _("All files|*|All supported files|") +
2414  all + wxT("|"); // "all" and "all supported" entries
2415  if (extraformat != wxEmptyString)
2416  { // append caller-defined format if supplied
2417  mask += extraformat + wxT("|") + extrafilter + wxT("|");
2418  }
2419  mask += filter; // put the names and extensions of all the importer formats
2420  // we built up earlier into the mask
2421 
2422  // Retrieve saved path and type
2423  wxString path = gPrefs->Read(wxT("/DefaultOpenPath"),::wxGetCwd());
2424  wxString type = gPrefs->Read(wxT("/DefaultOpenType"),mask.BeforeFirst(wxT('|')));
2425 
2426  // Convert the type to the filter index
2427  int index = mask.First(type + wxT("|"));
2428  if (index == wxNOT_FOUND) {
2429  index = 0;
2430  }
2431  else {
2432  index = mask.Left(index).Freq(wxT('|')) / 2;
2433  if (index < 0) {
2434  index = 0;
2435  }
2436  }
2437 
2438  // Construct and display the file dialog
2439  wxArrayString selected;
2440 
2441  FileDialog dlog(NULL,
2442  _("Select one or more audio files..."),
2443  path,
2444  wxT(""),
2445  mask,
2446  wxFD_OPEN | wxFD_MULTIPLE | wxRESIZE_BORDER);
2447 
2448  dlog.SetFilterIndex(index);
2449 
2450  int dialogResult = dlog.ShowModal();
2451 
2452  // Convert the filter index to type and save
2453  index = dlog.GetFilterIndex();
2454  for (int i = 0; i < index; i++) {
2455  mask = mask.AfterFirst(wxT('|')).AfterFirst(wxT('|'));
2456  }
2457  gPrefs->Write(wxT("/DefaultOpenType"), mask.BeforeFirst(wxT('|')));
2458  gPrefs->Write(wxT("/LastOpenType"), mask.BeforeFirst(wxT('|')));
2459  gPrefs->Flush();
2460 
2461  if (dialogResult == wxID_OK) {
2462  // Return the selected files
2463  dlog.GetPaths(selected);
2464  }
2465  return selected;
2466 }

2468 // static method, can be called outside of a project
2469 bool AudacityProject::IsAlreadyOpen(const wxString & projPathName)
2470 {
2471  wxFileName newProjPathName(projPathName);
2472  size_t numProjects = gAudacityProjects.Count();
2473  for (size_t i = 0; i < numProjects; i++)
2474  {
2475  if (newProjPathName.SameAs(gAudacityProjects[i]->mFileName))
2476  {
2477  wxString errMsg =
2478  wxString::Format(_("%s is already open in another window."),
2479  newProjPathName.GetName().c_str());
2480  wxLogError(errMsg);
2481  wxMessageBox(errMsg, _("Error Opening Project"), wxOK | wxCENTRE);
2482  return true;
2483  }
2484  }
2485  return false;

2488 // static method, can be called outside of a project
2489 void AudacityProject::OpenFiles(AudacityProject *proj)
2490 {
2491  /* i18n-hint: This string is a label in the file type filter in the open
2492  * and save dialogues, for the option that only shows project files created
2493  * with Audacity. Do not include pipe symbols or .aup (this extension will
2494  * now be added automatically for the Save Projects dialogues).*/
2495  wxArrayString selectedFiles = ShowOpenDialog(_("Audacity projects"), wxT("*.aup"));
2496  if (selectedFiles.GetCount() == 0) {
2497  gPrefs->Write(wxT("/LastOpenType"),wxT(""));
2498  gPrefs->Flush();
2499  return;
2500  }
2501 
2502  //sort selected files by OD status.
2503  //For the open menu we load OD first so user can edit asap.
2504  //first sort selectedFiles.
2505  selectedFiles.Sort(CompareNoCaseFileName);
2506  ODManager::Pause();
2507 
2508  for (size_t ff = 0; ff < selectedFiles.GetCount(); ff++) {
2509  wxString fileName = selectedFiles[ff];
2510 
2511  // Make sure it isn't already open.
2512  if (AudacityProject::IsAlreadyOpen(fileName))
2513  continue; // Skip ones that are already open.
2514 
2515  gPrefs->Write(wxT("/DefaultOpenPath"), wxPathOnly(fileName));
2516  gPrefs->Flush();
2517 
2518  // DMM: If the project is dirty, that means it's been touched at
2519  // all, and it's not safe to open a NEW project directly in its
2520  // place. Only if the project is brand-NEW clean and the user
2521  // hasn't done any action at all is it safe for Open to take place
2522  // inside the current project.
2523  //
2524  // If you try to Open a NEW project inside the current window when
2525  // there are no tracks, but there's an Undo history, etc, then
2526  // bad things can happen, including data files moving to the NEW
2527  // project directory, etc.
2528  if (!proj || proj->mDirty || !proj->mTracks->IsEmpty()) {
2529  // Open in a NEW window
2530  proj = CreateNewAudacityProject();
2531  }
2532  // This project is clean; it's never been touched. Therefore
2533  // all relevant member variables are in their initial state,
2534  // and it's okay to open a NEW project inside this window.
2535  proj->OpenFile(fileName);
2536  }
2537 
2538  gPrefs->Write(wxT("/LastOpenType"),wxT(""));
2539  gPrefs->Flush();
2540 
2541  ODManager::Resume();
2542 
2543 }

2545 // Most of this string was duplicated 3 places. Made the warning consistent in this global.
2546 // The %s is to be filled with the version string.
2547 static wxString gsLegacyFileWarning =
2548 _("This file was saved by Audacity version %s. The format has changed. \
2549 \n\nAudacity can try to open and save this file, but saving it in this \
2550 \nversion will then prevent any 1.2 or earlier version opening it. \
2551 \n\nAudacity might corrupt the file in opening it, so you should \
2552 back it up first. \
2553 \n\nOpen this file now?");
2554 
2555 bool AudacityProject::WarnOfLegacyFile( )
2556 {
2557  wxString msg;
2558  msg.Printf(gsLegacyFileWarning, _("1.0 or earlier"));
2559 
2560  // Stop icon, and choose 'NO' by default.
2561  int action =
2562  wxMessageBox(msg,
2563  _("Warning - Opening Old Project File"),
2564  wxYES_NO | wxICON_STOP | wxNO_DEFAULT | wxCENTRE,
2565  this);
2566  return (action != wxNO);
2567 }

2570 // FIXME? This should return a result that is checked.
2571 // See comment in AudacityApp::MRUOpen().
2572 void AudacityProject::OpenFile(const wxString &fileNameArg, bool addtohistory)
2573 {
2574  wxString fileName(fileNameArg);
2575 
2576  // On Win32, we may be given a short (DOS-compatible) file name on rare
2577  // occassions (e.g. stuff like "C:\PROGRA~1\AUDACI~1\PROJEC~1.AUP"). We
2578  // convert these to long file name first.
2579  fileName = PlatformCompatibility::ConvertSlashInFileName(
2580  PlatformCompatibility::GetLongFileName(fileName));
2581 
2582  // Make sure it isn't already open.
2583  // Vaughan, 2011-03-25: This was done previously in AudacityProject::OpenFiles()
2584  // and AudacityApp::MRUOpen(), but if you open an aup file by double-clicking it
2585  // from, e.g., Win Explorer, it would bypass those, get to here with no check,
2586  // then open a NEW project from the same data with no warning.
2587  // This was reported in http://bugzilla.audacityteam.org/show_bug.cgi?id=137#c17,
2588  // but is not really part of that bug. Anyway, prevent it!
2589  if (AudacityProject::IsAlreadyOpen(fileName))
2590  return;
2591 
2592 
2593  // Data loss may occur if users mistakenly try to open ".aup.bak" files
2594  // left over from an unsuccessful save or by previous versions of Audacity.
2595  // So we always refuse to open such files.
2596  if (fileName.Lower().EndsWith(wxT(".aup.bak")))
2597  {
2598  wxMessageBox(
2599  _("You are trying to open an automatically created backup file.\nDoing this may result in severe data loss.\n\nPlease open the actual Audacity project file instead."),
2600  _("Warning - Backup File Detected"),
2601  wxOK | wxCENTRE, this);
2602  return;
2603  }
2604 
2605  if (!::wxFileExists(fileName)) {
2606  wxMessageBox(_("Could not open file: ") + fileName,
2607  _("Error Opening File"),
2608  wxOK | wxCENTRE, this);
2609  return;
2610  }
2611 
2612  // We want to open projects using wxTextFile, but if it's NOT a project
2613  // file (but actually a WAV file, for example), then wxTextFile will spin
2614  // for a long time searching for line breaks. So, we look for our
2615  // signature at the beginning of the file first:
2616 
2617  char buf[16];
2618  {
2619  wxFFile ff(fileName, wxT("rb"));
2620  if (!ff.IsOpened()) {
2621  wxMessageBox(_("Could not open file: ") + fileName,
2622  _("Error opening file"),
2623  wxOK | wxCENTRE, this);
2624  }
2625  int numRead = ff.Read(buf, 15);
2626  if (numRead != 15) {
2627  wxMessageBox(wxString::Format(_("File may be invalid or corrupted: \n%s"),
2628  (const wxChar*)fileName), _("Error Opening File or Project"),
2629  wxOK | wxCENTRE, this);
2630  ff.Close();
2631  return;
2632  }
2633  buf[15] = 0;
2634  }
2635 
2636  wxString temp = LAT1CTOWX(buf);
2637 
2638  if (temp == wxT("AudacityProject")) {
2639  // It's an Audacity 1.0 (or earlier) project file.
2640  // If they bail out, return and do no more.
2641  if( !WarnOfLegacyFile() )
2642  return;
2643  // Convert to the NEW format.
2644  bool success = ConvertLegacyProjectFile(wxFileName(fileName));
2645  if (!success) {
2646  wxMessageBox(_("Audacity was unable to convert an Audacity 1.0 project to the new project format."),
2647  _("Error Opening Project"),
2648  wxOK | wxCENTRE, this);
2649  return;
2650  }
2651  else {
2652  temp = wxT("<?xml ");
2653  }
2654  }
2655 
2656  //FIXME: //v Surely we could be smarter about this, like checking much earlier that this is a .aup file.
2657  if (temp.Mid(0, 6) != wxT("<?xml ")) {
2658  // If it's not XML, try opening it as any other form of audio
2659  Import(fileName);
2660  return;
2661  }
2662 
2666 
2667  mFileName = fileName;
2668 
2669  mRecoveryAutoSaveDataDir = wxT("");
2670  mIsRecovered = false;
2671 
2672  SetProjectTitle();
2673 
2674  const wxString autoSaveExt = wxT(".autosave");
2675  if (mFileName.Length() >= autoSaveExt.Length() &&
2676  mFileName.Right(autoSaveExt.Length()) == autoSaveExt)
2677  {
2678  AutoSaveFile asf;
2679  if (!asf.Decode(fileName))
2680  {
2681  wxMessageBox(_("Could not decode file: ") + fileName,
2682  _("Error decoding file"),
2683  wxOK | wxCENTRE, this);
2684  return;
2685  }
2686  }
2687 
2688  XMLFileReader xmlFile;
2689 
2690  bool bParseSuccess = xmlFile.Parse(this, fileName);
2691  if (bParseSuccess) {
2692  // By making a duplicate set of pointers to the existing blocks
2693  // on disk, we add one to their reference count, guaranteeing
2694  // that their reference counts will never reach zero and thus
2695  // the version saved on disk will be preserved until the
2696  // user selects Save().
2697 
2698  bool err = false;
2699  Track *t;
2700  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
2701  mLastSavedTracks = new TrackList();
2702 
2703  t = iter.First();
2704  while (t) {
2705  if (t->GetErrorOpening())
2706  {
2707  wxLogWarning(
2708  wxT("Track %s had error reading clip values from project file."),
2709  t->GetName().c_str());
2710  err = true;
2711  }
2712 
2713  // Sanity checks for linked tracks; unsetting the linked property
2714  // doesn't fix the problem, but it likely leaves us with orphaned
2715  // blockfiles instead of much worse problems.
2716  if (t->GetLinked())
2717  {
2718  Track *l = t->GetLink();
2719  if (l)
2720  {
2721  // A linked track's partner should never itself be linked
2722  if (l->GetLinked())
2723  {
2724  wxLogWarning(
2725  wxT("Left track %s had linked right track %s with extra right track link.\n Removing extra link from right track."),
2726  t->GetName().c_str(), l->GetName().c_str());
2727  err = true;
2728  l->SetLinked(false);
2729  }
2730 
2731  // Channels should be left and right
2732  if ( !( (t->GetChannel() == Track::LeftChannel &&
2733  l->GetChannel() == Track::RightChannel) ||
2734  (t->GetChannel() == Track::RightChannel &&
2735  l->GetChannel() == Track::LeftChannel) ) )
2736  {
2737  wxLogWarning(
2738  wxT("Track %s and %s had left/right track links out of order. Setting tracks to not be linked."),
2739  t->GetName().c_str(), l->GetName().c_str());
2740  err = true;
2741  t->SetLinked(false);
2742  }
2743  }
2744  else
2745  {
2746  wxLogWarning(
2747  wxT("Track %s had link to NULL track. Setting it to not be linked."),
2748  t->GetName().c_str());
2749  err = true;
2750  t->SetLinked(false);
2751  }
2752  }
2753 
2754  mLastSavedTracks->Add(t->Duplicate());
2755  t = iter.Next();
2756  }
2757 
2758  InitialState();
2759  mTrackPanel->SetFocusedTrack(iter.First());
2760  HandleResize();
2761  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
2762  mTrackPanel->Update(); // force any repaint to happen now,
2763  // else any asynch calls into the blockfile code will not have
2764  // finished logging errors (if any) before the call to ProjectFSCK()
2765 
2766  if (addtohistory) {
2767  wxGetApp().AddFileToHistory(fileName);
2768  }
2769 
2770  if (mIsRecovered)
2771  {
2772  // This project has been recovered, so write a NEW auto-save file
2773  // now and then DELETE the old one in the auto-save folder. Note that
2774  // at this point mFileName != fileName, because when opening a
2775  // recovered file mFileName is faked to point to the original file
2776  // which has been recovered, not the one in the auto-save folder.
2777  GetDirManager()->ProjectFSCK(err, true); // Correct problems in auto-recover mode.
2778 
2779  // PushState calls AutoSave(), so no longer need to do so here.
2780  this->PushState(_("Project was recovered"), _("Recover"));
2781 
2782  if (!wxRemoveFile(fileName))
2783  wxMessageBox(_("Could not remove old auto save file"),
2784  _("Error"), wxICON_STOP, this);
2785  }
2786  else
2787  {
2788  // This is a regular project, check it and ask user
2789  int status = GetDirManager()->ProjectFSCK(err, false);
2790  if (status & FSCKstatus_CLOSE_REQ)
2791  {
2792  // Vaughan, 2010-08-23: Note this did not do a real close.
2793  // It could cause problems if you get this, say on missing alias files,
2794  // then try to open a project with, e.g., missing blockfiles.
2795  // It then failed in SetProject, saying it cannot find the files,
2796  // then never go through ProjectFSCK to give more info.
2797  // Going through OnClose() may be overkill, but it's safe.
2798  /*
2799  // There was an error in the load/check and the user
2800  // explictly opted to close the project.
2801  mTracks->Clear(true);
2802  mFileName = wxT("");
2803  SetProjectTitle();
2804  mTrackPanel->Refresh(true);
2805  */
2806  this->OnClose();
2807  }
2808  else if (status & FSCKstatus_CHANGED)
2809  {
2810  // Mark the wave tracks as changed and redraw.
2811  t = iter.First();
2812  while (t) {
2813  if (t->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
2814  {
2815  // Only wave tracks have a notion of "changed".
2816  for (WaveClipList::compatibility_iterator clipIter = ((WaveTrack*)t)->GetClipIterator();
2817  clipIter;
2818  clipIter=clipIter->GetNext())
2819  clipIter->GetData()->MarkChanged();
2820  }
2821  t = iter.Next();
2822  }
2823  mTrackPanel->Refresh(true);
2824 
2825  // Vaughan, 2010-08-20: This was bogus, as all the actions in DirManager::ProjectFSCK
2826  // that return FSCKstatus_CHANGED cannot be undone.
2827  // this->PushState(_("Project checker repaired file"), _("Project Repair"));
2828 
2829  if (status & FSCKstatus_SAVE_AUP)
2830  this->Save();
2831  }
2832  }
2833  } else {
2834  // Vaughan, 2011-10-30:
2835  // See first topic at http://bugzilla.audacityteam.org/show_bug.cgi?id=451#c16.
2836  // Calling mTracks->Clear() with deleteTracks true results in data loss.
2837  mTracks->Clear(); //mTracks->Clear(true);
2838 
2839  mFileName = wxT("");
2840  SetProjectTitle();
2841 
2842  wxLogError(wxT("Could not parse file \"%s\". \nError: %s"), fileName.c_str(), xmlFile.GetErrorStr().c_str());
2843  wxMessageBox(xmlFile.GetErrorStr(),
2844  _("Error Opening Project"),
2845  wxOK | wxCENTRE, this);
2846  }
2847 
2848  // Clean up now unused recording recovery handler if any
2849  if (mRecordingRecoveryHandler)
2850  {
2851  delete mRecordingRecoveryHandler;
2852  mRecordingRecoveryHandler = NULL;
2853  }
2854 
2855  if (!bParseSuccess)
2856  return; // No need to do further processing if parse failed.
2857 
2858  GetDirManager()->FillBlockfilesCache();
2859 
2860  //check the ODManager to see if we should add the tracks to the ODManager.
2861  //this flag would have been set in the HandleXML calls from above, if there were
2862  //OD***Blocks.
2863  if(ODManager::HasLoadedODFlag())
2864  {
2865  Track *tr;
2866  TrackListIterator triter(mTracks);
2867  tr = triter.First();
2868 
2869  std::vector<ODTask*> newTasks;
2870  ODTask* newTask;
2871  //std::vector<ODDecodeTask*> decodeTasks;
2872  unsigned int createdODTasks=0;
2873  while (tr) {
2874  if (tr->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
2875  //check the track for blocks that need decoding.
2876  //There may be more than one type e.g. FLAC/FFMPEG/lame
2877  unsigned int odFlags;
2878  odFlags=((WaveTrack*)tr)->GetODFlags();
2879 
2880  //add the track to the already created tasks that correspond to the od flags in the wavetrack.
2881  for(unsigned int i=0;i<newTasks.size();i++) {
2882  if(newTasks[i]->GetODType() & odFlags)
2883  newTasks[i]->AddWaveTrack((WaveTrack*)tr);
2884  }
2885 
2886  //create whatever NEW tasks we need to.
2887  //we want at most one instance of each class for the project
2888  while((odFlags|createdODTasks) != createdODTasks)
2889  {
2890  newTask=NULL;
2891 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_OD_FLAC
2892  if(!(createdODTasks&ODTask::eODFLAC) && odFlags & ODTask::eODFLAC) {
2893  newTask= new ODDecodeFlacTask;
2894  createdODTasks= createdODTasks | ODTask::eODFLAC;
2895  }
2896  else
2897 #endif
2898  if(!(createdODTasks&ODTask::eODPCMSummary) && odFlags & ODTask::eODPCMSummary) {
2899  newTask=new ODComputeSummaryTask;
2900  createdODTasks= createdODTasks | ODTask::eODPCMSummary;
2901  }
2902  else {
2903  printf("unrecognized OD Flag in block file.\n");
2904  //TODO:ODTODO: display to user. This can happen when we build audacity on a system that doesnt have libFLAC
2905  break;
2906  }
2907  if(newTask)
2908  {
2909  newTask->AddWaveTrack((WaveTrack*)tr);
2910  newTasks.push_back(newTask);
2911  }
2912  }
2913  }
2914  tr = triter.Next();
2915  }
2916  for(unsigned int i=0;i<newTasks.size();i++)
2917  ODManager::Instance()->AddNewTask(newTasks[i]);
2918 
2919  //release the flag.
2920  ODManager::UnmarkLoadedODFlag();
2921  }
2922 
2923  // For an unknown reason, OSX requires that the project window be
2924  // raised if a recovery took place.
2925  Raise();
2926 }

2928 bool AudacityProject::HandleXMLTag(const wxChar *tag, const wxChar **attrs)
2929 {
2930  bool bFileVersionFound = false;
2931  wxString fileVersion = _("<unrecognized version -- possibly corrupt project file>");
2932  wxString audacityVersion = _("<unrecognized version -- possibly corrupt project file>");
2933  int requiredTags = 0;
2934  long longVpos = 0;
2935 
2936  // loop through attrs, which is a null-terminated list of
2937  // attribute-value pairs
2938  while(*attrs) {
2939  const wxChar *attr = *attrs++;
2940  const wxChar *value = *attrs++;
2941 
2942  if (!value || !XMLValueChecker::IsGoodString(value))
2943  break;
2944 
2945  if (mViewInfo.ReadXMLAttribute(attr, value)) {
2946  // We need to save vpos now and restore it below
2947  longVpos = std::max(longVpos, long(mViewInfo.vpos));
2948  continue;
2949  }
2950 
2951  if (!wxStrcmp(attr, wxT("datadir")))
2952  {
2953  //
2954  // This is an auto-saved version whose data is in another directory
2955  //
2956  // Note: This attribute must currently be written and parsed before
2957  // any other attributes
2958  //
2959  if ((value[0] != 0) && XMLValueChecker::IsGoodPathString(value))
2960  {
2961  // Remember that this is a recovered project
2962  mIsRecovered = true;
2963  mRecoveryAutoSaveDataDir = value;
2964  }
2965  }
2966 
2967  else if (!wxStrcmp(attr, wxT("version")))
2968  {
2969  fileVersion = value;
2970  bFileVersionFound = true;
2971  requiredTags++;
2972  }
2973 
2974  else if (!wxStrcmp(attr, wxT("audacityversion"))) {
2975  audacityVersion = value;
2976  requiredTags++;
2977  }
2978 
2979  else if (!wxStrcmp(attr, wxT("projname"))) {
2980  wxString projName;
2981  wxString projPath;
2982 
2983  if (mIsRecovered) {
2984  // Fake the filename as if we had opened the original file
2985  // (which was lost by the crash) rather than the one in the
2986  // auto save folder
2987  wxFileName realFileDir;
2988  realFileDir.AssignDir(mRecoveryAutoSaveDataDir);
2989  realFileDir.RemoveLastDir();
2990 
2991  wxString realFileName = value;
2992  if (realFileName.Length() >= 5 &&
2993  realFileName.Right(5) == wxT("_data"))
2994  {
2995  realFileName = realFileName.Left(realFileName.Length() - 5);
2996  }
2997 
2998  if (realFileName.IsEmpty())
2999  {
3000  // A previously unsaved project has been recovered, so fake
3001  // an unsaved project. The data files just stay in the temp
3002  // directory
3003  mDirManager->SetLocalTempDir(mRecoveryAutoSaveDataDir);
3004  mFileName = wxT("");
3005  projName = wxT("");
3006  projPath = wxT("");
3007  } else
3008  {
3009  realFileName += wxT(".aup");
3010  projPath = realFileDir.GetFullPath();
3011  mFileName = wxFileName(projPath, realFileName).GetFullPath();
3012  projName = value;
3013  }
3014 
3015  SetProjectTitle();
3016  } else {
3017  projName = value;
3018  projPath = wxPathOnly(mFileName);
3019  }
3020 
3021  if (!projName.IsEmpty())
3022  {
3023  // First try to load the data files based on the _data dir given in the .aup file
3024  // If this fails then try to use the filename of the .aup as the base directory
3025  // This is because unzipped projects e.g. those that get transfered between mac-pc
3026  // have encoding issues and end up expanding the wrong filenames for certain
3027  // international characters (such as capital 'A' with an umlaut.)
3028  if (!mDirManager->SetProject(projPath, projName, false))
3029  {
3030  projName = GetName() + wxT("_data");
3031  if (!mDirManager->SetProject(projPath, projName, false)) {
3032  wxMessageBox(wxString::Format(_("Couldn't find the project data folder: \"%s\""),
3033  projName.c_str()),
3034  _("Error Opening Project"),
3035  wxOK | wxCENTRE, this);
3036  return false;
3037  }
3038  }
3039  }
3040 
3041  requiredTags++;
3042  }
3043 
3044  else if (!wxStrcmp(attr, wxT("rate"))) {
3045  Internat::CompatibleToDouble(value, &mRate);
3046  GetSelectionBar()->SetRate(mRate);
3047  }
3048 
3049  else if (!wxStrcmp(attr, wxT("snapto"))) {
3050  SetSnapTo(wxString(value) == wxT("on") ? true : false);
3051  }
3052 
3053  else if (!wxStrcmp(attr, wxT("selectionformat")))
3054  SetSelectionFormat(value);
3055 
3056  else if (!wxStrcmp(attr, wxT("frequencyformat")))
3057  SetFrequencySelectionFormatName(value);
3058 
3059  else if (!wxStrcmp(attr, wxT("bandwidthformat")))
3060  SetBandwidthSelectionFormatName(value);
3061  } // while
3062 
3063  mViewInfo.UpdatePrefs();
3064 
3065  if (longVpos != 0) {
3066  // PRL: It seems this must happen after SetSnapTo
3067  mViewInfo.track = NULL;
3068  mViewInfo.vpos = longVpos;
3069  mbInitializingScrollbar = true;
3070  }
3071 
3072  // Specifically detect newer versions of Audacity
3073  // WARNING: This will need review/revision if we ever have a version string
3074  // such as 1.5.10, i.e. with 2 digit numbers.
3075  // We're able to do a shortcut and use string comparison because we know
3076  // that does not happen.
3077 
3078  if (!bFileVersionFound ||
3079  (fileVersion.Length() != 5) || // expecting '1.1.0', for example
3080  !XMLValueChecker::IsGoodInt(fileVersion) ||
3081  (fileVersion > wxT(AUDACITY_FILE_FORMAT_VERSION)))
3082  {
3083  wxString msg;
3084  /* i18n-hint: %s will be replaced by the version number.*/
3085  msg.Printf(_("This file was saved using Audacity %s.\nYou are using Audacity %s. You may need to upgrade to a newer version to open this file."),
3086  audacityVersion.c_str(),
3087  AUDACITY_VERSION_STRING);
3088  wxMessageBox(msg,
3089  _("Can't open project file"),
3090  wxOK | wxICON_EXCLAMATION | wxCENTRE, this);
3091  return false;
3092  }
3093 
3094  // NOTE: It looks as if there was some confusion about fileversion and audacityversion.
3095  // fileversion NOT being increased when file formats changed, so unfortunately we're
3096  // using audacityversion to rescue the situation.
3097 
3098  // KLUDGE: guess the true 'fileversion' by stripping away any '-beta-Rc' stuff on
3099  // audacityVersion.
3100  // It's fairly safe to do this as it has already been established that the
3101  // puported file version was five chars long.
3102  fileVersion = audacityVersion.Mid(0,5);
3103 
3104  bool bIsOld = fileVersion < wxT(AUDACITY_FILE_FORMAT_VERSION);
3105  bool bIsVeryOld = fileVersion < wxT("1.1.9" );
3106  // Very old file versions could even have the file version starting
3107  // with text: 'AudacityProject Version 0.95'
3108  // Atoi return zero in this case.
3109  bIsVeryOld |= wxAtoi( fileVersion )==0;
3110  // Specifically detect older versions of Audacity
3111  if ( bIsOld | bIsVeryOld ) {
3112  wxString msg;
3113  msg.Printf(gsLegacyFileWarning, audacityVersion.c_str());
3114 
3115  int icon_choice = wxICON_EXCLAMATION;
3116  if( bIsVeryOld )
3117  // Stop icon, and choose 'NO' by default.
3118  icon_choice = wxICON_STOP | wxNO_DEFAULT;
3119  int action =
3120  wxMessageBox(msg,
3121  _("Warning - Opening Old Project File"),
3122  wxYES_NO | icon_choice | wxCENTRE,
3123  this);
3124  if (action == wxNO)
3125  return false;
3126  }
3127 
3128  if (wxStrcmp(tag, wxT("audacityproject")) &&
3129  wxStrcmp(tag, wxT("project"))) {
3130  // If the tag name is not one of these two (the NEW name is
3131  // "project" with an Audacity namespace, but we don't detect
3132  // the namespace yet), then we don't know what the error is
3133  return false;
3134  }
3135 
3136  if (requiredTags < 3)
3137  return false;
3138 
3139  // All other tests passed, so we succeed
3140  return true;
3141 }
