3363 bool AudacityProject::Save(bool overwrite /* = true */ ,
3364  bool fromSaveAs /* = false */,
3365  bool bWantSaveCompressed /*= false*/)
3366 {
3367  // See explanation above
3368  // ProjectDisabler disabler(this);
3369 
3370  if (bWantSaveCompressed)
3371  wxASSERT(fromSaveAs);
3372  else
3373  {
3374  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
3375  bool bHasTracks = (iter.First() != NULL);
3376  if (!bHasTracks)
3377  {
3378  if (GetUndoManager()->UnsavedChanges() && mEmptyCanBeDirty) {
3379  int result = wxMessageBox(_("Your project is now empty.\nIf saved, the project will have no tracks.\n\nTo save any previously open tracks:\nClick 'No', Edit > Undo until all tracks\nare open, then File > Save Project.\n\nSave anyway?"),
3380  _("Warning - Empty Project"),
3381  wxYES_NO | wxICON_QUESTION, this);
3382  if (result == wxNO)
3383  return false;
3384  }
3385  }
3386 
3387  if (!fromSaveAs && mDirManager->GetProjectName() == wxT(""))
3388  return SaveAs();
3389 
3390  // If the user has recently imported dependencies, show
3391  // a dialog where the user can see audio files that are
3392  // aliased by this project. The user may make the project
3393  // self-contained during this dialog, it modifies the project!
3394  if (mImportedDependencies)
3395  {
3396  bool bSuccess = ShowDependencyDialogIfNeeded(this, true);
3397  if (!bSuccess)
3398  return false;
3399  mImportedDependencies = false; // do not show again
3400  }
3401  }
3402 
3403  //
3404  // Always save a backup of the original project file
3405  //
3406 
3407  wxString safetyFileName = wxT("");
3408  if (wxFileExists(mFileName)) {
3409 
3410 #ifdef __WXGTK__
3411  safetyFileName = mFileName + wxT("~");
3412 #else
3413  safetyFileName = mFileName + wxT(".bak");
3414 #endif
3415 
3416  if (wxFileExists(safetyFileName))
3417  wxRemoveFile(safetyFileName);
3418 
3419  wxRename(mFileName, safetyFileName);
3420  }
3421 
3422  if (fromSaveAs || mDirManager->GetProjectName() == wxT("")) {
3423  // Write the tracks.
3424 
3425  // This block of code is duplicated in WriteXML, for now...
3426  wxString project = mFileName;
3427  if (project.Len() > 4 && project.Mid(project.Len() - 4) == wxT(".aup"))
3428  project = project.Mid(0, project.Len() - 4);
3429  wxString projName = wxFileNameFromPath(project) + wxT("_data");
3430  wxString projPath = wxPathOnly(project);
3431 
3432  mWantSaveCompressed = bWantSaveCompressed;
3433  bool success = false;
3434 
3435  if( !wxDir::Exists( projPath ) ){
3436  if (safetyFileName != wxT(""))
3437  wxRename(safetyFileName, mFileName);
3438  wxMessageBox(wxString::Format(
3439  _("Could not save project. Path not found. Try creating \ndirectory \"%s\" before saving project with this name."),
3440  projPath.c_str()),
3441  _("Error Saving Project"),
3442  wxICON_ERROR, this);
3443  return false;
3444  }
3445 
3446  if (bWantSaveCompressed)
3447  {
3448  //v Move this condition into SaveCompressedWaveTracks() if want to support other formats.
3449  #ifdef USE_LIBVORBIS
3450  success = this->SaveCompressedWaveTracks(project);
3451  #endif
3452  }
3453  else
3454  {
3455  // We are about to move files from the current directory to
3456  // the NEW directory. We need to make sure files that belonged
3457  // to the last saved project don't get erased, so we "lock" them, so that
3458  // SetProject() copies instead of moves the files.
3459  // (Otherwise the NEW project would be fine, but the old one would
3460  // be empty of all of its files.)
3461 
3462  if (mLastSavedTracks && !overwrite)
3463  LockAllBlocks();
3464 
3465  // This renames the project directory, and moves or copies
3466  // all of our block files over.
3467  success = mDirManager->SetProject(projPath, projName, !overwrite);
3468 
3469  if (mLastSavedTracks && !overwrite)
3470  UnlockAllBlocks();
3471  }
3472 
3473  if (!success) {
3474  if (safetyFileName != wxT(""))
3475  wxRename(safetyFileName, mFileName);
3476  wxMessageBox(wxString::Format(_("Could not save project. Perhaps %s \nis not writable or the disk is full."),
3477  project.c_str()),
3478  _("Error Saving Project"),
3479  wxICON_ERROR, this);
3480  return false;
3481  }
3482  }
3483 
3484  // Write the AUP file.
3485  XMLFileWriter saveFile;
3486 
3487  try
3488  {
3489  saveFile.Open(mFileName, wxT("wb"));
3490 
3491  WriteXMLHeader(saveFile);
3492  WriteXML(saveFile);
3493 
3494  saveFile.Close();
3495  }
3496  catch (const XMLFileWriterException &exception)
3497  {
3498  wxMessageBox(wxString::Format(
3499  _("Couldn't write to file \"%s\": %s"),
3500  mFileName.c_str(), exception.GetMessage().c_str()),
3501  _("Error Saving Project"), wxICON_ERROR);
3502 
3503  // When XMLWriter throws an exception, it tries to close it before,
3504  // so we can at least try to DELETE the incomplete file and move the
3505  // backup file over.
3506  if (safetyFileName != wxT(""))
3507  {
3508  wxRemove(mFileName);
3509  wxRename(safetyFileName, mFileName);
3510  }
3511 
3512  return false;
3513  }
3514 
3515  if (bWantSaveCompressed)
3516  mWantSaveCompressed = false; // Don't want this mode for AudacityProject::WriteXML() any more.
3517  else
3518  {
3519  // Now that we have saved the file, we can DELETE the auto-saved version
3520  DeleteCurrentAutoSaveFile();
3521 
3522  if (mIsRecovered)
3523  {
3524  // This was a recovered file, that is, we have just overwritten the
3525  // old, crashed .aup file. There may still be orphaned blockfiles in
3526  // this directory left over from the crash, so we DELETE them now
3527  mDirManager->RemoveOrphanBlockfiles();
3528 
3529  // Before we saved this, this was a recovered project, but now it is
3530  // a regular project, so remember this.
3531  mIsRecovered = false;
3532  mRecoveryAutoSaveDataDir = wxT("");
3533  SetProjectTitle();
3534  } else if (fromSaveAs)
3535  {
3536  // On save as, always remove orphaned blockfiles that may be left over
3537  // because the user is trying to overwrite another project
3538  mDirManager->RemoveOrphanBlockfiles();
3539  }
3540 
3541  if (mLastSavedTracks) {
3542  mLastSavedTracks->Clear(true);
3543  delete mLastSavedTracks;
3544  }
3545 
3546  mLastSavedTracks = new TrackList();
3547 
3548  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
3549  Track *t = iter.First();
3550  Track *dupT;
3551  while (t) {
3552  dupT = t->Duplicate();
3553  mLastSavedTracks->Add(dupT);
3554 
3555  //only after the xml has been saved we can mark it saved.
3556  //thus is because the OD blockfiles change on background thread while this is going on.
3557  // if(dupT->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
3558  // ((WaveTrack*)dupT)->MarkSaved();
3559 
3560  t = iter.Next();
3561  }
3562 
3563  GetUndoManager()->StateSaved();
3564  }
3565 
3566  // If we get here, saving the project was successful, so we can DELETE
3567  // the .bak file (because it now does not fit our block files anymore
3568  // anyway).
3569  if (safetyFileName != wxT(""))
3570  wxRemoveFile(safetyFileName);
3571 
3572  mStatusBar->SetStatusText(wxString::Format(_("Saved %s"),
3573  mFileName.c_str()), mainStatusBarField);
3574 
3575  return true;
3576 }

3578 #ifdef USE_LIBVORBIS
3579  bool AudacityProject::SaveCompressedWaveTracks(const wxString & strProjectPathName) // full path for aup except extension
3580  {
3581  // Some of this is similar to code in ExportMultiple::ExportMultipleByTrack
3582  // but that code is really tied into the dialogs.
3583 
3584  // Copy the tracks because we're going to do some state changes before exporting.
3585  Track* pSavedTrack;
3586  Track* pTrack;
3587  WaveTrack* pWaveTrack;
3588  TrackListOfKindIterator iter(Track::Wave, mTracks);
3589  unsigned int numWaveTracks = 0;
3590 
3591  TrackList pSavedTrackList(true);
3592  for (pTrack = iter.First(); pTrack != NULL; pTrack = iter.Next())
3593  {
3594  numWaveTracks++;
3595  pWaveTrack = (WaveTrack*)pTrack;
3596  pSavedTrack = mTrackFactory->DuplicateWaveTrack(*pWaveTrack);
3597  pSavedTrackList.Add(pSavedTrack);
3598  }
3599 
3600  if (numWaveTracks == 0)
3601  // Nothing to save compressed => success. Delete the copies and go.
3602  return true;
3603 
3604  // Okay, now some bold state-faking to default values.
3605  for (pTrack = iter.First(); pTrack != NULL; pTrack = iter.Next())
3606  {
3607  pWaveTrack = (WaveTrack*)pTrack;
3608  pWaveTrack->SetSelected(false);
3609  pWaveTrack->SetMute(false);
3610  pWaveTrack->SetSolo(false);
3611 
3612  pWaveTrack->SetGain(1.0);
3613  pWaveTrack->SetPan(0.0);
3614  }
3615 
3616  wxString strDataDirPathName = strProjectPathName + wxT("_data");
3617  if (!wxFileName::DirExists(strDataDirPathName) &&
3618  !wxFileName::Mkdir(strDataDirPathName, 0777, wxPATH_MKDIR_FULL))
3619  return false;
3620  strDataDirPathName += wxFileName::GetPathSeparator();
3621 
3622  // Export all WaveTracks to OGG.
3623  bool bSuccess = true;
3624  Exporter theExporter;
3625  Track* pRightTrack;
3626  wxFileName uniqueTrackFileName;
3627  for (pTrack = iter.First(); ((pTrack != NULL) && bSuccess); pTrack = iter.Next())
3628  {
3629  if (pTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
3630  {
3631  pTrack->SetSelected(true);
3632  if (pTrack->GetLinked())
3633  {
3634  pRightTrack = iter.Next();
3635  pRightTrack->SetSelected(true);
3636  }
3637  else
3638  pRightTrack = NULL;
3639 
3640  uniqueTrackFileName = wxFileName(strDataDirPathName, pTrack->GetName(), wxT("ogg"));
3641  FileNames::MakeNameUnique(mStrOtherNamesArray, uniqueTrackFileName);
3642  bSuccess =
3643  theExporter.Process(this, pRightTrack ? 2 : 1,
3644  wxT("OGG"), uniqueTrackFileName.GetFullPath(), true,
3645  pTrack->GetStartTime(), pTrack->GetEndTime());
3646 
3647  pTrack->SetSelected(false);
3648  if (pRightTrack)
3649  pRightTrack->SetSelected(false);
3650  }
3651  }
3652 
3653  // Restore the saved track states and clean up.
3654  TrackListIterator savedTrackIter(&pSavedTrackList);
3655  for (pTrack = iter.First(), pSavedTrack = savedTrackIter.First();
3656  ((pTrack != NULL) && (pSavedTrack != NULL));
3657  pTrack = iter.Next(), pSavedTrack = savedTrackIter.Next())
3658  {
3659  pWaveTrack = (WaveTrack*)pTrack;
3660  pWaveTrack->SetSelected(pSavedTrack->GetSelected());
3661  pWaveTrack->SetMute(pSavedTrack->GetMute());
3662  pWaveTrack->SetSolo(pSavedTrack->GetSolo());
3663 
3664  pWaveTrack->SetGain(((WaveTrack*)pSavedTrack)->GetGain());
3665  pWaveTrack->SetPan(((WaveTrack*)pSavedTrack)->GetPan());
3666  }
3667 
3668  return bSuccess;
3669  }
3670 #endif

3673 void AudacityProject::AddImportedTracks(const wxString &fileName,
3674  Track **newTracks, int numTracks)
3675 {
3676  SelectNone();
3677 
3678  bool initiallyEmpty = mTracks->IsEmpty();
3679  double newRate = 0;
3680  wxString trackNameBase = fileName.AfterLast(wxFILE_SEP_PATH).BeforeLast('.');
3681  bool isLinked = false;
3682  for (int i = 0; i < numTracks; i++) {
3683  if (newRate == 0 && newTracks[i]->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
3684  newRate = ((WaveTrack *)newTracks[i])->GetRate();
3685  }
3686  mTracks->Add(newTracks[i]);
3687  newTracks[i]->SetSelected(true);
3688  //we need to check link status based on the first channel only.
3689  if(0==i)
3690  isLinked = newTracks[i]->GetLinked();
3691  if (numTracks > 2 || (numTracks > 1 && !isLinked) ) {
3692  newTracks[i]->SetName(trackNameBase + wxString::Format(wxT(" %d" ), i + 1));
3693  }
3694  else {
3695  newTracks[i]->SetName(trackNameBase);
3696  }
3697 
3698  // Check if NEW track contains aliased blockfiles and if yes,
3699  // remember this to show a warning later
3700  if (newTracks[i]->GetKind() == WaveTrack::Wave)
3701  {
3702  WaveClip* clip = ((WaveTrack*)newTracks[i])->GetClipByIndex(0);
3703  BlockArray &blocks = clip->GetSequence()->GetBlockArray();
3704  if (clip && blocks.size())
3705  {
3706  SeqBlock& block = blocks[0];
3707  if (block.f->IsAlias())
3708  {
3709  mImportedDependencies = true;
3710  }
3711  }
3712  }
3713  }
3714 
3715  delete[]newTracks;
3716 
3717  // Automatically assign rate of imported file to whole project,
3718  // if this is the first file that is imported
3719  if (initiallyEmpty && newRate > 0) {
3720  mRate = newRate;
3721  GetSelectionBar()->SetRate(mRate);
3722  }
3723 
3724  PushState(wxString::Format(_("Imported '%s'"), fileName.c_str()),
3725  _("Import"));
3726 
3727 #if defined(__WXGTK__)
3728  // See bug #1224
3729  // The track panel hasn't we been fully created, so the OnZoomFit() will not give
3730  // expected results due to a window width of zero. Should be safe to yield here to
3731  // allow the creattion to complete. If this becomes a problem, it "might" be possible
3732  // to queue a dummy event to trigger the OnZoomFit().
3733  wxEventLoopBase::GetActive()->YieldFor(wxEVT_CATEGORY_UI | wxEVT_CATEGORY_USER_INPUT);
3734 #endif
3735 
3736  OnZoomFit();
3737 
3738  mTrackPanel->SetFocus();
3739  mTrackPanel->EnsureVisible(mTrackPanel->GetFirstSelectedTrack());
3740  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
3741 
3742  if (initiallyEmpty && mDirManager->GetProjectName() == wxT("")) {
3743  wxString name = fileName.AfterLast(wxFILE_SEP_PATH).BeforeLast(wxT('.'));
3744  mFileName =::wxPathOnly(fileName) + wxFILE_SEP_PATH + name + wxT(".aup");
3745  SetProjectTitle();
3746  }
3747 
3748  // Moved this call to higher levels to prevent flicker redrawing everything on each file.
3749  // HandleResize();
3750 }

3752 // If pNewTrackList is passed in non-NULL, it gets filled with the pointers to NEW tracks.
3753 bool AudacityProject::Import(const wxString &fileName, WaveTrackArray* pTrackArray /*= NULL*/)
3754 {
3755  Track **newTracks;
3756  int numTracks;
3757  wxString errorMessage = wxEmptyString;
3758 
3759  // Backup Tags, before the import. Be prepared to roll back changes.
3760  struct TempTags {
3761  TempTags(std::shared_ptr<Tags> & pTags_)
3762  : pTags(pTags_)
3763  {
3764  oldTags = pTags;
3765  if (oldTags)
3766  pTags = oldTags->Duplicate();
3767  }
3768 
3769  ~TempTags()
3770  {
3771  if (oldTags) {
3772  // roll back
3773  pTags = oldTags;
3774  }
3775  }
3776 
3777  void Commit()
3778  {
3779  oldTags.reset();
3780  }
3781 
3782  std::shared_ptr<Tags> & pTags;
3783  std::shared_ptr<Tags> oldTags;
3784  };
3785  TempTags tempTags(mTags);
3786 
3787  numTracks = Importer::Get().Import(fileName,
3788  mTrackFactory,
3789  &newTracks,
3790  mTags.get(),
3791  errorMessage);
3792 
3793  if (!errorMessage.IsEmpty()) {
3794 // Version that goes to internet...
3795 // ShowErrorDialog(this, _("Error Importing"),
3796 // errorMessage, wxT("http://audacity.sourceforge.net/help/faq?s=files&i=wma-proprietary"));
3797 // Version that looks locally for the text.
3798  ShowErrorDialog(this, _("Error Importing"),
3799  errorMessage, wxT("innerlink:wma-proprietary"));
3800  }
3801  if (numTracks <= 0)
3802  return false;
3803 
3804  wxGetApp().AddFileToHistory(fileName);
3805 
3806  // no more errors
3807  tempTags.Commit();
3808 
3809  // for LOF ("list of files") files, do not import the file as if it
3810  // were an audio file itself
3811  if (fileName.AfterLast('.').IsSameAs(wxT("lof"), false)) {
3812  // PRL: don't redundantly do the steps below, because we already
3813  // did it in case of LOF, because of some weird recursion back to this
3814  // same function. I think this should be untangled.
3815 
3816  // So Undo history push is not bypassed, despite appearances.
3817  return false;
3818  }
3819 
3820  // Have to set up newTrackList before calling AddImportedTracks,
3821  // because AddImportedTracks deletes newTracks.
3822  if (pTrackArray) {
3823  for (int i = 0; i < numTracks; i++) {
3824  if (newTracks[i]->GetKind() == Track::Wave) {
3825  pTrackArray->push_back(static_cast<WaveTrack *>(newTracks[i]));
3826  }
3827  }
3828  }
3829 
3830  // PRL: Undo history is incremented inside this:
3831  AddImportedTracks(fileName, newTracks, numTracks);
3832 
3833  int mode = gPrefs->Read(wxT("/AudioFiles/NormalizeOnLoad"), 0L);
3834  if (mode == 1) {
3835  //TODO: All we want is a SelectAll()
3836  SelectNone();
3837  SelectAllIfNone();
3838  OnEffect(EffectManager::Get().GetEffectByIdentifier(wxT("Normalize")),
3839  OnEffectFlags::kConfigured);
3840  }
3841 
3842  GetDirManager()->FillBlockfilesCache();
3843  return true;
3844 }

3846 bool AudacityProject::SaveAs(const wxString & newFileName, bool bWantSaveCompressed /*= false*/, bool addToHistory /*= true*/)
3847 {
3848  wxString oldFileName = mFileName;
3849 
3850  //check to see if the NEW project file already exists.
3851  //We should only overwrite it if this project already has the same name, where the user
3852  //simply chose to use the save as command although the save command would have the effect.
3853  if(mFileName!=newFileName && wxFileExists(newFileName)) {
3854  wxMessageDialog m(
3855  NULL,
3856  _("The project was not saved because the file name provided would overwrite another project.\nPlease try again and select an original name."),
3857  _("Error Saving Project"),
3858  wxOK|wxICON_ERROR);
3859  m.ShowModal();
3860  return false;
3861  }
3862 
3863  mFileName = newFileName;
3864  SetProjectTitle();
3865 
3866  bool success = Save(false, true, bWantSaveCompressed);
3867 
3868  if (success && addToHistory) {
3869  wxGetApp().AddFileToHistory(mFileName);
3870  }
3871  if (!success || bWantSaveCompressed) // bWantSaveCompressed doesn't actually change current project.
3872  {
3873  // Reset file name on error
3874  mFileName = oldFileName;
3875  SetProjectTitle();
3876  }
3877 
3878  return(success);
3879 }

3897 Compressed project files are a good way to transmit your project online, \n\
3898 but they have some loss of fidelity.\n\n\

3935

3938  //simply chose to use the save as command although the save command would have the effect.
3939  if (mFileName != fName && filename.FileExists()) {

3941  NULL,

3943  _("Error Saving Project"),
3944  wxOK|wxICON_ERROR);
3945  m.ShowModal();
3946  return false;
3947  }
3948 
3949  wxString oldFileName = mFileName;
3950  mFileName = fName;
3951  SetProjectTitle();
3952 
3953  bool success = Save(false, true, bWantSaveCompressed);
3954 
3955  if (success) {
3956  wxGetApp().AddFileToHistory(mFileName);
3957  }
3958  if (!success || bWantSaveCompressed) // bWantSaveCompressed doesn't actually change current project.
3959  {
3960  // Reset file name on error
3961  mFileName = oldFileName;
3962  SetProjectTitle();
3963  }
3964 
3965  return(success);

4005 void AudacityProject::PushState(const wxString &desc,
4006  const wxString &shortDesc,
4007  UndoPush flags )
4008 {
4009  GetUndoManager()->PushState(mTracks, mViewInfo.selectedRegion, mTags,
4010  desc, shortDesc, flags);
4011 
4012  mDirty = true;
4013 
4014  if (mHistoryWindow)
4015  mHistoryWindow->UpdateDisplay();
4016 
4017  ModifyUndoMenuItems();
4018 
4019  UpdateMenus();
4020 
4021  // Some state pushes, like changing a track gain control (& probably others),
4022  // should not repopulate Lyrics Window and MixerBoard.
4023  // Others, such as deleting a label or adding a wave track, obviously do.
4024  // Could categorize these state changes, but for now...
4025  // It's crucial to not do that repopulating during playback.
4026  if (!gAudioIO->IsStreamActive(GetAudioIOToken()))
4027  {
4028  this->UpdateLyrics();
4029  this->UpdateMixerBoard();
4030  }
4031 
4032  if (GetTracksFitVerticallyZoomed())
4033  this->DoZoomFitV();
4034  if((flags & UndoPush::AUTOSAVE) != UndoPush::MINIMAL)
4035  AutoSave();
4036 }

4038 void AudacityProject::RollbackState()
4039 {
4040  SetStateTo(GetUndoManager()->GetCurrentState());
4041 }

4043 void AudacityProject::ModifyState(bool bWantsAutoSave)
4044 {
4045  GetUndoManager()->ModifyState(mTracks, mViewInfo.selectedRegion, mTags);
4046  if (bWantsAutoSave)
4047  AutoSave();
4048 }
4049 
4050 // LL: Is there a memory leak here as "l" and "t" are not deleted???
4051 // Vaughan, 2010-08-29: No, as "l" is a TrackList* of an Undo stack state.
4052 // Need to keep it and its tracks "t" available for Undo/Redo/SetStateTo.
4053 void AudacityProject::PopState(const UndoState &state)
4054 {
4055  // Restore tags
4056  mTags = state.tags;
4057 
4058  TrackList *const tracks = state.tracks.get();
4059 
4060  mTracks->Clear(true);
4061  TrackListIterator iter(tracks);
4062  Track *t = iter.First();
4063  bool odUsed = false;
4064  ODComputeSummaryTask* computeTask = NULL;
4065  Track* copyTrack;
4066 
4067  while (t)
4068  {
4069  copyTrack=t->Duplicate();
4070  mTracks->Add(copyTrack);
4071 
4072  //add the track to OD if the manager exists. later we might do a more rigorous check...
4073  if (copyTrack->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
4074  {
4075  //if the ODManager hasn't been initialized, there's no chance this track has OD blocks since this
4076  //is a "Redo" operation.
4077  //TODO: update this to look like the update loop in OpenFile that handles general purpose ODTasks.
4078  //BUT, it is too slow to go thru every blockfile and check the odtype, so maybe put a flag in wavetrack
4079  //that gets unset on OD Completion, (and we could also update the drawing there too.) The hard part is that
4080  //we would need to watch every possible way a OD Blockfile could get inserted into a wavetrack and change the
4081  //flag there.
4082  if(ODManager::IsInstanceCreated())
4083  {
4084  if(!odUsed)
4085  {
4086  computeTask=new ODComputeSummaryTask;
4087  odUsed=true;
4088  }
4089  computeTask->AddWaveTrack((WaveTrack*)copyTrack);
4090  }
4091  }
4092  t = iter.Next();
4093  }
4094 
4095  //add the task.
4096  if(odUsed)
4097  ODManager::Instance()->AddNewTask(computeTask);
4098 
4099  HandleResize();
4100 
4101  UpdateMenus();
4102  this->UpdateLyrics();
4103  this->UpdateMixerBoard();
4104 
4105  AutoSave();
4106 }

4108 void AudacityProject::SetStateTo(unsigned int n)
4109 {
4110  const UndoState &state =
4111  GetUndoManager()->SetStateTo(n, &mViewInfo.selectedRegion);
4112  PopState(state);
4113 
4114  HandleResize();
4115  mTrackPanel->SetFocusedTrack(NULL);
4116  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
4117  ModifyUndoMenuItems();
4118  this->UpdateLyrics();
4119  this->UpdateMixerBoard();
4120 }

4122 void AudacityProject::UpdateLyrics()
4123 {
4124  // JKC: Previously we created a lyrics window,
4125  // if it did not exist. But we don't need to.
4126  if (!mLyricsWindow)
4127  return;
4128 
4129  TrackListOfKindIterator iter(Track::Label, mTracks);
4130  LabelTrack* pLabelTrack = (LabelTrack*)(iter.First()); // Lyrics come from only the first label track.
4131  if (!pLabelTrack)
4132  return;
4133 
4134  // The code that updates the lyrics is rather expensive when there
4135  // are a lot of labels.
4136  // So - bail out early if the lyrics window is not visible.
4137  // We will later force an update when the lyrics window is made visible.
4138  if( !mLyricsWindow->IsVisible() )
4139  return;
4140 
4141  Lyrics* pLyricsPanel = mLyricsWindow->GetLyricsPanel();
4142  pLyricsPanel->Clear();
4143  pLyricsPanel->AddLabels(pLabelTrack);
4144  pLyricsPanel->Finish(pLabelTrack->GetEndTime());
4145  pLyricsPanel->Update(this->GetSel0());
4146 }

4156  //mMixerBoard->UpdateMeters(gAudioIO->GetStreamTime(), (mLastPlayMode == loopedPlay));

4199 void AudacityProject::Clear()
4200 {
4201  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
4202 
4203  Track *n = iter.First();
4204 
4205  while (n) {
4206  if (n->GetSelected() || n->IsSyncLockSelected()) {
4207  n->Clear(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(), mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
4208  }
4209  n = iter.Next();
4210  }
4211 
4212  double seconds = mViewInfo.selectedRegion.duration();
4213 
4214  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.collapseToT0();
4215 
4216  PushState(wxString::Format(_("Deleted %.2f seconds at t=%.2f"),
4217  seconds,
4218  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0()),
4219  _("Delete"));
4220 
4221  RedrawProject();
4222 }

4252 // This method 'rewinds' the track, by setting the cursor to 0 and
4253 // scrolling the window to fit 0 on the left side of it
4254 // (maintaining current zoom).
4255 // If shift is held down, it will extend the left edge of the
4256 // selection to 0 (holding right edge constant), otherwise it will
4257 // move both left and right edge of selection to 0
4259 void AudacityProject::Rewind(bool shift)
4260 {
4261  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT0(0, false);
4262  if (!shift)
4263  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT1(0);
4264 
4265  TP_ScrollWindow(0);
4266 }
4267 
4268 
4270 // This method 'fast-forwards' the track, by setting the cursor to
4271 // the end of the samples on the selected track and scrolling the
4272 // window to fit the end on its right side (maintaining current zoom).
4273 // If shift is held down, it will extend the right edge of the
4274 // selection to the end (holding left edge constant), otherwise it will
4275 // move both left and right edge of selection to the end
4277 void AudacityProject::SkipEnd(bool shift)
4278 {
4279  double len = mTracks->GetEndTime();
4280 
4281  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT1(len, false);
4282  if (!shift)
4283  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.setT0(len);
4284 
4285  // Make sure the end of the track is visible
4286  mTrackPanel->ScrollIntoView(len);
4287  mTrackPanel->Refresh(false);
4288 }

4395 void AudacityProject::OnTimer(wxTimerEvent& WXUNUSED(event))
4396 {
4397  MixerToolBar *mixerToolBar = GetMixerToolBar();
4398  if( mixerToolBar )
4399  mixerToolBar->UpdateControls();
4400 
4401  if (::wxGetUTCTime() - mLastStatusUpdateTime < 3)
4402  return;
4403 
4404  // gAudioIO->GetNumCaptureChannels() should only be positive
4405  // when we are recording.
4406  if (GetAudioIOToken() > 0 && gAudioIO->GetNumCaptureChannels() > 0) {
4407  wxLongLong freeSpace = mDirManager->GetFreeDiskSpace();
4408  if (freeSpace >= 0) {
4409  wxString msg;
4410  double recTime;
4411  int recMins;
4412 
4413  recTime = freeSpace.GetHi() * 4294967296.0 + freeSpace.GetLo();
4414  recTime /= SAMPLE_SIZE_DISK(gAudioIO->GetCaptureFormat());
4415  // note size on disk (=3 for 24-bit) not in memory (=4 for 24-bit)
4416  recTime /= gAudioIO->GetNumCaptureChannels();
4417  recTime /= GetRate();
4418  recMins = (int)(recTime / 60.0);
4419 
4420  if (recMins >= 120)
4421  msg.Printf(_("Disk space remains for recording %d hours and %d minutes."),
4422  recMins/60, recMins%60);
4423  else if (recMins >= 60)
4424  msg.Printf(_("Disk space remains for recording 1 hour and %d minutes."),
4425  recMins-60);
4426  else if (recMins > 3)
4427  msg.Printf(_("Disk space remains for recording %d minutes."),
4428  recMins);
4429  else if (recTime >= 2)
4430  msg.Printf(_("Disk space remains for recording %d seconds."),
4431  (int)recTime);
4432  else
4433  msg.Printf(_("Out of disk space"));
4434 
4435  mStatusBar->SetStatusText(msg, mainStatusBarField);
4436  }
4437  }
4438  else if(ODManager::IsInstanceCreated())
4439  {
4440  //if we have some tasks running, we should say something about it.
4441  int numTasks = ODManager::Instance()->GetTotalNumTasks();
4442  if(numTasks)
4443  {
4444  wxString msg;
4445  float ratioComplete= ODManager::Instance()->GetOverallPercentComplete();
4446 
4447  if(ratioComplete>=1.0f)
4448  {
4449  //if we are 100 percent complete and there is still a task in the queue, we should wake the ODManager
4450  //so it can clear it.
4451  //signal the od task queue loop to wake up so it can remove the tasks from the queue and the queue if it is empty.
4452  ODManager::Instance()->SignalTaskQueueLoop();
4453 
4454 
4455  msg.Printf(_("On-demand import and waveform calculation complete."));
4456  mStatusBar->SetStatusText(msg, mainStatusBarField);
4457 
4458  }
4459  else if(numTasks>1)
4460  msg.Printf(_("Import(s) complete. Running %d on-demand waveform calculations. Overall %2.0f%% complete."),
4461  numTasks,ratioComplete*100.0);
4462  else
4463  msg.Printf(_("Import complete. Running an on-demand waveform calculation. %2.0f%% complete."),
4464  ratioComplete*100.0);
4465 
4466 
4467  mStatusBar->SetStatusText(msg, mainStatusBarField);
4468  }
4469  }
4470 }
4471 
4472 //get regions selected by selected labels
4473 //removes unnecessary regions, overlapping regions are merged
4474 //regions memory need to be deleted by the caller
4475 void AudacityProject::GetRegionsByLabel( Regions &regions )
4476 {
4477  TrackListIterator iter( mTracks );
4478  Track *n;
4479 
4480  //determine labelled regions
4481  for( n = iter.First(); n; n = iter.Next() )
4482  if( n->GetKind() == Track::Label && n->GetSelected() )
4483  {
4484  LabelTrack *lt = ( LabelTrack* )n;
4485  for( int i = 0; i < lt->GetNumLabels(); i++ )
4486  {
4487  const LabelStruct *ls = lt->GetLabel( i );
4488  if( ls->selectedRegion.t0() >= mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0() &&
4489  ls->selectedRegion.t1() <= mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1() )
4490  regions.push_back(Region(ls->getT0(), ls->getT1()));
4491  }
4492  }
4493 
4494  //anything to do ?
4495  if( regions.size() == 0 )
4496  return;
4497 
4498  //sort and remove unnecessary regions
4499  std::sort(regions.begin(), regions.end());
4500  unsigned int selected = 1;
4501  while( selected < regions.size() )
4502  {
4503  const Region &cur = regions.at( selected );
4504  Region &last = regions.at( selected - 1 );
4505  if( cur.start < last.end )
4506  {
4507  if( cur.end > last.end )
4508  last.end = cur.end;
4509  regions.erase( regions.begin() + selected );
4510  }
4511  else
4512  selected++;
4513  }
4514 }
4515 
4516 //Executes the edit function on all selected wave tracks with
4517 //regions specified by selected labels
4518 //If No tracks selected, function is applied on all tracks
4519 //If the function replaces the selection with audio of a different length,
4520 // bSyncLockedTracks should be set true to perform the same action on sync-lock selected
4521 // tracks.
4522 void AudacityProject::EditByLabel( EditFunction action,
4523  bool bSyncLockedTracks )
4524 {
4525  Regions regions;
4526 
4527  GetRegionsByLabel( regions );
4528  if( regions.size() == 0 )
4529  return;
4530 
4531  TrackListIterator iter( mTracks );
4532  Track *n;
4533  bool allTracks = true;
4534 
4535  // if at least one wave track is selected
4536  // apply only on the selected track
4537  for( n = iter.First(); n; n = iter.Next() )
4538  if( n->GetKind() == Track::Wave && n->GetSelected() )
4539  {
4540  allTracks = false;
4541  break;
4542  }
4543 
4544  //Apply action on wavetracks starting from
4545  //labeled regions in the end. This is to correctly perform
4546  //actions like 'Delete' which collapse the track area.
4547  n = iter.First();
4548  while (n)
4549  {
4550  if ((n->GetKind() == Track::Wave) &&
4551  (allTracks || n->GetSelected() || (bSyncLockedTracks && n->IsSyncLockSelected())))
4552  {
4553  WaveTrack *wt = ( WaveTrack* )n;
4554  for (int i = (int)regions.size() - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
4555  const Region &region = regions.at(i);
4556  (wt->*action)(region.start, region.end);
4557  }
4558  }
4559  n = iter.Next();
4560  }
4561 }
4562 
4563 //Executes the edit function on all selected wave tracks with
4564 //regions specified by selected labels
4565 //If No tracks selected, function is applied on all tracks
4566 //Functions copy the edited regions to clipboard, possibly in multiple tracks
4567 //This probably should not be called if *action() changes the timeline, because
4568 // the copy needs to happen by track, and the timeline change by group.
4569 void AudacityProject::EditClipboardByLabel( EditDestFunction action )
4570 {
4571  Regions regions;
4572 
4573  GetRegionsByLabel( regions );
4574  if( regions.size() == 0 )
4575  return;
4576 
4577  TrackListIterator iter( mTracks );
4578  Track *n;
4579  bool allTracks = true;
4580 
4581  // if at least one wave track is selected
4582  // apply only on the selected track
4583  for( n = iter.First(); n; n = iter.Next() )
4584  if( n->GetKind() == Track::Wave && n->GetSelected() )
4585  {
4586  allTracks = false;
4587  break;
4588  }
4589 
4590  ClearClipboard();
4591  //Apply action on wavetracks starting from
4592  //labeled regions in the end. This is to correctly perform
4593  //actions like 'Cut' which collapse the track area.
4594  for( n = iter.First(); n; n = iter.Next() )
4595  {
4596  if( n->GetKind() == Track::Wave && ( allTracks || n->GetSelected() ) )
4597  {
4598  WaveTrack *wt = ( WaveTrack* )n;
4599  WaveTrack *merged = NULL;
4600  for( int i = ( int )regions.size() - 1; i >= 0; i-- )
4601  {
4602  Track *dest = NULL;
4603  const Region &region = regions.at(i);
4604  ( wt->*action )( region.start, region.end,
4605  &dest );
4606  if( dest )
4607  {
4608  dest->SetChannel( wt->GetChannel() );
4609  dest->SetLinked( wt->GetLinked() );
4610  dest->SetName( wt->GetName() );
4611  if( !merged )
4612  merged = ( WaveTrack* )dest;
4613  else
4614  {
4615  // Paste to the beginning; unless this is the first region,
4616  // offset the track to account for time between the regions
4617  if (i < (int)regions.size() - 1)
4618  merged->Offset(
4619  regions.at(i + 1).start - region.end);
4620 
4621  bool bResult = merged->Paste( 0.0 , dest );
4622  wxASSERT(bResult); // TO DO: Actually handle this.
4623  wxUnusedVar(bResult);
4624  delete dest;
4625  }
4626  }
4627  else // nothing copied but there is a 'region', so the 'region' must be a 'point label' so offset
4628  if (i < (int)regions.size() - 1)
4629  if (merged)
4630  merged->Offset(
4631  regions.at(i + 1).start - region.end);
4632  }
4633  if( merged )
4634  msClipboard->Add( merged );
4635  }
4636  }
4637 
4638  msClipT0 = regions.front().start;
4639  msClipT1 = regions.back().end;
4640 }

4650 // Set the status indirectly, using the command system
4651 // (more overhead, but can be used from a non-GUI thread)
4652 void AudacityProject::SafeDisplayStatusMessage(const wxChar *msg)
4653 {
4654  CommandOutputTarget *target
4655  = new CommandOutputTarget(TargetFactory::ProgressDefault(),
4656  new StatusBarTarget(*mStatusBar),
4657  TargetFactory::MessageDefault());
4658  CommandType *type = CommandDirectory::Get()->LookUp(wxT("Message"));
4659  wxASSERT_MSG(type != NULL, wxT("Message command not found!"));
4660  Command *statusCmd = type->Create(target);
4661  statusCmd->SetParameter(wxT("MessageString"), msg);
4662  ScriptCommandRelay::PostCommand(this, statusCmd);
4663 
4664  // Although the status hasn't actually been set yet, updating the time now
4665  // is probably accurate enough
4666  mLastStatusUpdateTime = ::wxGetUTCTime();
4667 }

4669 void AudacityProject::TP_DisplaySelection()
4670 {
4671  double audioTime;
4672 
4673  if (gAudioIO->IsBusy())
4674  audioTime = gAudioIO->GetStreamTime();
4675  else {
4676  audioTime = 0;
4677  }
4678 
4679  GetSelectionBar()->SetTimes(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
4680  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1(), audioTime);
4681 #ifdef EXPERIMENTAL_SPECTRAL_EDITING
4682  GetSpectralSelectionBar()->SetFrequencies
4683  (mViewInfo.selectedRegion.f0(), mViewInfo.selectedRegion.f1());
4684 #endif
4685 
4686  if (mRuler) {
4687  if (!gAudioIO->IsBusy() && !mLockPlayRegion)
4688  mRuler->SetPlayRegion(mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t0(),
4689  mViewInfo.selectedRegion.t1());
4690  else
4691  // Cause ruler redraw anyway, because we may be zooming or scrolling

4754 void AudacityProject::AutoSave()
4755 {
4756  // SonifyBeginAutoSave(); // part of RBD's r10680 stuff now backed out
4757 
4758  // To minimize the possibility of race conditions, we first write to a
4759  // file with the extension ".tmp", then rename the file to .autosave
4760  wxString projName;
4761 
4762  if (mFileName.IsEmpty())
4763  projName = wxT("New Project");
4764  else
4765  projName = wxFileName(mFileName).GetName();
4766 
4767  wxString fn = wxFileName(FileNames::AutoSaveDir(),
4768  projName + wxString(wxT(" - ")) + CreateUniqueName()).GetFullPath();
4769 
4770  try
4771  {
4772  VarSetter<bool> setter(&mAutoSaving, true, false);
4773 
4774  AutoSaveFile buffer;
4775  WriteXMLHeader(buffer);
4776  WriteXML(buffer);
4777 
4778  wxFFile saveFile;
4779  saveFile.Open(fn + wxT(".tmp"), wxT("wb"));
4780  buffer.Write(saveFile);
4781  saveFile.Close();
4782  }
4783  catch (const XMLFileWriterException &exception)
4784  {
4785  wxMessageBox(wxString::Format(
4786  _("Couldn't write to file \"%s\": %s"),
4787  (fn + wxT(".tmp")).c_str(), exception.GetMessage().c_str()),
4788  _("Error Writing Autosave File"), wxICON_ERROR, this);
4789 
4790  return;
4791  }
4792 
4793  // Now that we have a NEW auto-save file, DELETE the old one
4794  DeleteCurrentAutoSaveFile();
4795 
4796  if (!mAutoSaveFileName.IsEmpty())
4797  return; // could not remove auto-save file
4798 
4799  if (!wxRenameFile(fn + wxT(".tmp"), fn + wxT(".autosave")))
4800  {
4801  wxMessageBox(_("Could not create autosave file: ") + fn +
4802  wxT(".autosave"), _("Error"), wxICON_STOP, this);
4803  return;
4804  }
4805 
4806  mAutoSaveFileName += fn + wxT(".autosave");
4807  // no-op cruft that's not #ifdefed for NoteTrack
4808  // See above for further comments.
4809  // SonifyEndAutoSave();
4810 }
4811 
4812 void AudacityProject::DeleteCurrentAutoSaveFile()
4813 {
4814  if (!mAutoSaveFileName.IsEmpty())
4815  {
4816  if (wxFileExists(mAutoSaveFileName))
4817  {
4818  if (!wxRemoveFile(mAutoSaveFileName))
4819  {
4820  wxMessageBox(_("Could not remove old autosave file: ") +
4821  mAutoSaveFileName, _("Error"), wxICON_STOP, this);
4822  return;
4823  }
4824  }
4825 
4826  mAutoSaveFileName = wxT("");
4827  }
4828 }

4864 // This is called after recording has stopped and all tracks have flushed.
4865 void AudacityProject::OnAudioIOStopRecording()
4866 {
4867  // Only push state if we were capturing and not monitoring
4868  if (GetAudioIOToken() > 0)
4869  {
4870  // Add to history
4871  PushState(_("Recorded Audio"), _("Record"));
4872 
4873  // Reset timer record
4874  if (IsTimerRecordCancelled())
4875  {
4876  OnUndo();
4877  ResetTimerRecordFlag();
4878  }
4879 
4880  // Refresh the project window
4881  FixScrollbars();
4882  RedrawProject();
4883  }
4884 
4885  // Write all cached files to disk, if any
4886  mDirManager->WriteCacheToDisk();
4887 
4888  // Now we auto-save again to get the project to a "normal" state again.
4889  AutoSave();
4890 }

5003 void AudacityProject::RemoveTrack(Track * toRemove)
5004 {
5005  // If it was focused, reassign focus to the next or, if
5006  // unavailable, the previous track.
5007  if (mTrackPanel->GetFocusedTrack() == toRemove) {
5008  Track *t = mTracks->GetNext(toRemove, true);
5009  if (t == NULL) {
5010  t = mTracks->GetPrev(toRemove, true);
5011  }
5012  mTrackPanel->SetFocusedTrack(t); // It's okay if this is NULL
5013  }
5014 
5015  wxString name = toRemove->GetName();
5016  Track *partner = toRemove->GetLink();
5017 
5018  if (toRemove->GetKind() == Track::Wave)
5019  {
5020  // Update mixer board displayed tracks.
5021  MixerBoard* pMixerBoard = this->GetMixerBoard();
5022  if (pMixerBoard)
5023  pMixerBoard->RemoveTrackCluster((WaveTrack*)toRemove); // Will remove partner shown in same cluster.
5024  }
5025 
5026  mTracks->Remove(toRemove, true);
5027  if (partner) {
5028  mTracks->Remove(partner, true);
5029  }
5030 
5031  if (mTracks->IsEmpty()) {
5032  mTrackPanel->SetFocusedTrack(NULL);
5033  }
5034 
5035  PushState(
5036  wxString::Format(_("Removed track '%s.'"),
5037  name.c_str()),
5038  _("Track Remove"));
5039 
5040  TP_RedrawScrollbars();
5041  HandleResize();
5042  GetTrackPanel()->Refresh(false);
5043 }
5044 
5045 void AudacityProject::HandleTrackMute(Track *t, const bool exclusive)
5046 {
5047  // "exclusive" mute means mute the chosen track and unmute all others.
5048  if (exclusive)
5049  {
5050  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
5051  Track *i = iter.First();
5052  while (i) {
5053  if (i == t) {
5054  i->SetMute(true);
5055  if(i->GetLinked()) { // also mute the linked track
5056  i = iter.Next();
5057  i->SetMute(true);
5058  }
5059  }
5060  else {
5061  i->SetMute(false);
5062  }
5063  i->SetSolo(false);
5064  i = iter.Next();
5065  }
5066  }
5067  else
5068  {
5069  // Normal click toggles this track.
5070  t->SetMute(!t->GetMute());
5071  if(t->GetLinked()) // set mute the same on both, if a pair
5072  {
5073  bool muted = t->GetMute();
5074  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
5075  Track *i = iter.First();
5076  while (i != t) { // search for this track
5077  i = iter.Next();
5078  }
5079  i = iter.Next(); // get the next one, since linked
5080  i->SetMute(muted); // and mute it as well
5081  }
5082 
5083  if (IsSoloSimple() || IsSoloNone())
5084  {
5085  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
5086  Track *i = iter.First();
5087  int nPlaying=0;
5088 
5089  // We also set a solo indicator if we have just one track / stereo pair playing.
5090  // otherwise clear solo on everything.
5091  while (i) {
5092  if( !i->GetMute())
5093  {
5094  nPlaying += 1;
5095  if(i->GetLinked())
5096  i = iter.Next(); // don't count this one as it is linked
5097  }
5098  i = iter.Next();
5099  }
5100 
5101  i = iter.First();
5102  while (i) {
5103  i->SetSolo( (nPlaying==1) && !i->GetMute() ); // will set both of a stereo pair
5104  i = iter.Next();
5105  }
5106  }
5107  }
5108  ModifyState(true);
5109 }
5110 
5111 // Type of solo (standard or simple) follows the set preference, unless
5112 // alternate == true, which causes the opposite behavior.
5113 void AudacityProject::HandleTrackSolo(Track *t, const bool alternate)
5114 {
5115  bool bSoloMultiple = !IsSoloSimple() ^ alternate;
5116 
5117  // Standard and Simple solo have opposite defaults:
5118  // Standard - Behaves as individual buttons, shift=radio buttons
5119  // Simple - Behaves as radio buttons, shift=individual
5120  // In addition, Simple solo will mute/unmute tracks
5121  // when in standard radio button mode.
5122  if ( bSoloMultiple )
5123  {
5124  t->SetSolo( !t->GetSolo() );
5125  if(t->GetLinked())
5126  {
5127  bool soloed = t->GetSolo();
5128  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
5129  Track *i = iter.First();
5130  while (i != t) { // search for this track
5131  i = iter.Next();
5132  }
5133  i = iter.Next(); // get the next one, since linked
5134  i->SetSolo(soloed); // and solo it as well
5135  }
5136  }
5137  else
5138  {
5139  // Normal click solo this track only, mute everything else.
5140  // OR unmute and unsolo everything.
5141  TrackListIterator iter(mTracks);
5142  Track *i = iter.First();
5143  bool bWasSolo = t->GetSolo();
5144  while (i) {
5145  if( i==t )
5146  {
5147  i->SetSolo(!bWasSolo);
5148  if( IsSoloSimple() )
5149  i->SetMute(false);
5150  if(t->GetLinked())
5151  {
5152  i = iter.Next();
5153  i->SetSolo(!bWasSolo);
5154  if( IsSoloSimple() )
5155  i->SetMute(false);
5156  }
5157  }
5158  else
5159  {
5160  i->SetSolo(false);
5161  if( IsSoloSimple() )
5162  i->SetMute(!bWasSolo);
5163  }
5164  i = iter.Next();
5165  }
5166  }
5167  ModifyState(true);
5168 }
